loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: Majeedan B. is a mother of four and lives with her family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is an artist and makes jewellery on order. Her husband owns a fruit cart and earns money selling fruit. Majeedan would be very thankful for a loan of US$250 to help her husband expand his fruit sales business.

loans.use: Expansion of a fruit sales business

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi N., 35 years old, is living in Luong Bang town, Hung Yen with her husband and 2 children. Before, like many other local residents, she did business on breeding animals. Her family income back then was only enough for living cost. In recent years, along with the local development, local residents’ needs increased and as a result, Mrs. N. decided to open a grocery store. This activity brings her a decent income and is very convenient for her to repay weekly. After 2 years of doing business, her average income is 150 USD/month. She is borrowing 950 USD to buy more merchandises and expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Nhạn, 35 tuổi, sống tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên cùng chồng và 2 con. Trước đây như phần lớn người dân trong vùng, công việc chủ yếu của chị là chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập cũng đủ cho những chi tiêu trong gia đình nhưng kinh tế chưa có nhiều thay đổi. Những năm gần đây cùng với sự phát triển của thị trấn, nhu cầu hàng hóa của người dân tăng lên Chị Nhạn quyết định mở một cửa hàng bách hóa. Công việc này mang lại thu nhập khá và cũng thuận lợi với việc trả tiền tuần. Sau 2 năm bán hàng mức thu nhập bình quân của chị Nhạn là 150USD/tháng. Chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng, mở rộng hoạt động kinh doanh của mình.

loans.use: Buy goods for general store

loans.name: Dios Es Amor, Group 1

texts.en:
Sonia is a 37 year old woman who lives in a small suburb outsiD. of the capital with nine other family members, including her two sons, four daughters and two grandchildren. She runs a small business from her home that sells prepared food. She is asking for this loan so that she can offer more food to her customers and community members, and in turn, make a larger profit.

Her dreams are to be able to better support her family and to see her children continue studying so that they can be smart and educated professionals with healthy and blessed families of their own.

Sonia says that things are often very hard. As her husband has passed away, she has been left to proviD. for everyone, as well as act as both a father and mother. She is very grateful however for the opportunity to take this loan out — and sends her thanks and love to all of you who are helping to support her!

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of food

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla, 47, is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband owns a truck which they use for transportation jobs. She works selling used clothing. They have two grown, married daughters. However, their daughters still need some financial support from their parents. Leyla has been working for 9 years now selling used clothing, an endeavor she began to supplement her husband's income to pay household expenses. She is requesting the loan to buy materials to replace their home's corrugated iron roof that is quite old and in bad condition. They try to keep their home in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Leyla es una mujer de 47 años de edad que habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, casada, su esposo tiene una camioneta la cual trabajan como acarreo, y ella vende ropa usada. Tienen dos hijas mujeres que ya son mayores de edad y están casadas, sin embargo siempre que ellas lo necesitan sus padres le apoyan económicamente. Doña Leyla hace 9 años se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa usada, el cual inició como alternativa de ingreso para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales que le permitan cambiar el techo y zinc de su cuarto que esta viejo y deteriorado, siendo ya solos tratan de mantener su casita en buenas condiciones.

loans.use: To replace her home's corrugated iron roof

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Day after day, Adela gets up early so that she can organize and tend her small business, formed barely two years ago. With the idea of generating extra income, she jumped on the idea of opening a small shop, something moreover that she already had experience doing. She worked before as a clerk in a store. That was the seed of the idea and she started off small, but always with the hope of growing and moving ahead. She and her husband are now the parents of three school-age children. Her husband is a factory worker and, happily, he completely supports her. In the future, she hopes to keep on growing her business and making it bigger and bigger but she knows that she needs a strong base to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Día a día Adela se levanta por las mañanas para poder arreglar y atender su pequeño negocio, el cual tiene apenas dos años de formado. Con la idea de contar con un ingreso adicional se animo a abrir una bodega. Porque además ya tenía cierta experiencia en ello; anteriormente ella estuvo trabajando en una tienda como vendedora. Es así que decidió empezar y lo hizo de a pocos, pero siempre con la esperanza de seguir creciendo y progresando. Actualmente ella y su esposo son padres de tres niños que se encuentran en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica, felizmente él la apoya en todo. En un futuro ella espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, implementarlo y hacerlo más grande, pero ella sabe que solo a base de esfuerzo lo podrá lograr.

loans.use: Stock more merchaise.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marina belongs to the Community Bank Women of the Future, and makes living selling flour made from grains (from wheat, from corn, from fava beans, kiwicha, peas). She sells at both the retail and wholesale level in the northern section of Lima. Her business is located in the district and province of Huaraz..

With this loan of USD $550, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy three sacks of wheat, 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of peas, 2 sacks of fava beans, to convert them into flour.

Mrs. Marina is 65 years old, is married and has 7 children. Her husband used to have a bakery, which he no longer does because of his age. He helps his wife in her business. Her income allows her to cover the expenses of the home and one of her daughters, who is a single mother of two children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del futuro, se dedica a la venta de harina de granos (harina de trigo, de maíz, de haba, kiwicha, arvejas), vende por mayor y menor en el cono norte de Lima. Su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz.

Con este préstamo de 1500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará 3 sacos de trigo, 3 sacos de maíz, 2 sacos de arvejas, 2 sacos de haba, para ser transformados en harina.

La señora Marina tiene 65 años, es casada con 7 hijos, su esposo antes tenia su panadería, ahora ya no por la edad a dejado este negocio, en la actualidad el apoya a su esposa en este negocio. Sus ingresos le permite solventar su gastos de su hogar y tiene una de sus hijas a cargo que es madre soltera con dos hijos.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sabine G., who was born on July 19, 1978 in Cotonou, is married to Moïse Kouton, a welder with his own workshop in Cotonou. The couple has two children, both at school. Sabine G. has run a business selling various products such as soap, candy, cookies, pasta and toothpaste in Cotonou for well over a decade. Facing high demand, she felt the need to increase her inventory. This led her to request a first-time loan on September 25, 2006 of CFA 10,000. She is now on her fourth loan, for which she is requesting CFA 100,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame G. Sabine née le 19/07/1978 à COTONOU est mariée à KOUTON Moïse, Soudeur autogène ayant son atelier à COTONOU. Ce couple a à son actif deux enfants tous scolarisés. G. Sabine a pour activité la vente de divers produits à comme le savon, les bombons, les galettes, les pâtes alimentaires et de pâtes dentifrices depuis une dizaine d'années à Cotonou. Confrontée à une forte demande, elle a ressenti la nécessité pour elle d’accroître son approvisionnement ; ce qui l’avait amené à faire recours à son premier crédit le 25/0906 pour un montant de prêt initial de 10000FCFA. Elle est à son quatrième crédit pour lequel elle sollicite 100 000F CFA.

loans.use: To buy 20 dozen tubes of toothpaste and various everyday staples

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario started her own business in order to help with the household expenses, since her husband has never had a steady job. Because her husband has always worked for himself, there are times when Rosario is the one who has to support her son and the household. On her own initiative, she made a trip to León-Moroleón-San Juan de los Lagos with her husband, and she seized the opportunity to purchase some clothing and footwear so that she could sell it to her acquaintances. They liked her merchandise, so little by little, her sales have been increasing.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase more clothing and footwear for the next season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario inició el negocio para ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya que como su esposo nunca ha tenido un trabajo fijo, siempre ha trabajado por su cuenta hay ocasiones en que ella es la que tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo y de la casa; por iniciativa propia se fue con su esposo a un viaje León-Moroleón-San Juan de los Lagos, y aprovecho para comprar un poco de zapato y ropa que empezó a venderla con sus conocidos, le gusto y poco a poco ha ido incrementado el volumen de sus ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder surtir más ropa y zapato escolar para la próxima temporada.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Mrs. Hul C. is a firewood seller and pig breeder in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Tith Sophea, assists his wife’s businesses in order to help improve their living conditions. Since her first business is doing well, Mrs. C. wants to expand; therefore she is requesting a loan to buy more firewood to resell. 

Mrs. C. is 44 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the other is of preschool age.  She previously obtained a loan, now fully repaid, to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, socia del Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido“, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en la Prolongación Loreto No 280. 

Se inicia en el negocio ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, aprovecha que su casa está ubicada en un lugar estratégico, y ya tiene buena cantidad de clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, con dicho capital comprará productos como gaseosas de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, frugos (Pulpin, Cifrut), agua mineral, galletas, yogurt de diferentes tamaños sabores y marcas, también quiere surtir su negocio con abarrotes, para ello comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botella de litro, huevos en javas, leche en caja, productos de aseo personal y detergente debido  a que estos artículos  son muy requeridos por los clientes. 

Silvia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con 2 de sus hijos, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias. Por su carisma y amabilidad en la atención atrae a los clientes, cree que tener un negocio surtido también garantiza las ventas. Su meta es surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia, member of the community bank "Tesoro Escondido" (Hidden Treasure), lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sales of sweets and beverages. The business is located in her own home at 280 Prolongación Loreto. She began the business when faced with the need to generate income to support her husband in the household costs. She took advantage of her house's good location and already has a good quantity of clients. With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy products like sodas of different brands, flavors, and sizes, frugos (Pulpin, Cifrut - beverages), mineral water, cookies, yogurts of different sizes, flavors, and brands. Also, she wants to expand her business with groceries, and for this, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, one-liter bottles of oil, eggs, boxed milk, personal toiletries, and detergent, because these items are requested often by her clients. Silvia is 37 years old, lives with her husband and two of her children; they are her motivation to fight and dedicate herself always to her daily activities. Due to her charisma and friendliness, she attracts a lot of customers. She believes that an expanded business guarantees sales. Her goal is to expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products like sodas, mineral water, cookies, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Resty Kayondo's Group

texts.en:
Resty is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45-year-old divorced woman with 1 daughter, age 30 years. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. Resty takes care of her mother. There is electricity and piped water at her home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Resty sells newspapers and operates a public pay phone in Bwaise, one of the city suburbs. She sells to an average of 50 people a day and works 6 days a week. Resty's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and medication. Resty bicycles to and from work. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Resty's main challenges include the rainy season, which disturbs her a lot, and overcomes it by using umbrellas. Resty has been with MCDT for over 5 years and is servicing her eighth loan, working all this long time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and acquire more telephone booths. .

loans.use: To increase stock and buy another telephone booth

loans.name: Duong  Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đường Thị Sự năm nay 34 tuổi, hiện hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Năm 2003 chị Sự đã xin tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay thêm vốn đầu tư cho kinh doanh. Sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị Sự đã có nhiều đổi thay. Hiện tại thu nhập từ buôn bán của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Đường Thị Sự is 34 years old. She and her husband sell basic goods. In 2003 Sự joined TYM fund to have capital to invest in her business.. After 5 years with TYM, her family financial situation has improved a lot. Today, their income from the sales is 3.000.000 VND a month. aFor this round of loan, Mrs Sự would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND to continue investing in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a sus 3 hijos que estudian y a su esposo quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, los lleva a vender por los  diferentes lugares de su zona, dejándolos al crédito o al contado, esta actividad la viene realizando hace un año atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tratar directamente con sus clientes. Cuenta con una fiel clientela que requieren mucho de sus productos y le va bien. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más productos de belleza y así estoquear mejor su pequeña vitrina de exhibición.
texts.en:
Maria is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her 3 school age children and her husband, who gives her great support. She sells beauty products in the different sections of her district. She accepts payments in cash or credit for her products. She has been in this business for a year now, and what she likes about her job is dealing directly with her clientele. She has loyal customers who really need her products, so her business is prospering. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products so that she can better stock her small display case.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase beauty products

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
Erkin G. offers transportation services in Istaravshan, Tajikistan, his home town. He started his own business 15 years ago after working as a public van driver. His enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of seven. Erkin works 16 hours a day to provide a decent living for his family. Today, he is planning to replace the fuel supply system with a Kapron gas-cylinder because it's cheaper than using petrol. He requests 2000 Somoni ($600 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is on your hands.   


Brief History of Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.   Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet Republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 


IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system.

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla S. is 55-years old and married to Regolo S., a carpenter. They live at Purok Santan, Owaon Dapitan City. They have 3 children and all are living with them.
	
Being a carpenter is not an easy task, so she wanted to help her husband by generating an income. At first, she had a garden at the back of their house and planted assorted vegetables and spices. Later, as she discovered that she was earning income and  decided to turn the activity into a small business. Her neighbors convinced her to join Paglaum MPC to acquire capital for her business. Fortunately, she liked the programs and services that Paglaum MPC offered and decided to become a member on January 16, 2007. Her first loan of 3,000PHP helped her to buy fertilizers and vegetable seedlings. The business runs smoothly and every week she has new customers to buy her sales products.
	
She is convinced that she could meet her weekly obligation so she has requested an amount of 11,000PHP because she’d like to start raising pigs as a  business. Her gardening business will still continue. She is very humble person and helps others in need.

loans.use: to start raising pigs as a business

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El Sr. Damian L. F. se dedica al comercio de Cd´s y DVD´s. Que vende en su pequeña tienda ubicada en la calle Figueroa un lugar bastante conocido en la ciudad de La Paz para el comercio de CD's y películas en DVD, también lleva gran parte de su mercaderia al departamento de Oruro. Actividad con la que mantiene a su familia de cinco integrantes sus tres hijos aún estudian en la escuela siendo este negocio el unico que tiene para dotar de ingresos a su familiaes por eso que se beneficia con el Financiamiento por parte de KIVA. En su tiempo con la institución ha demostrado calidez humana y mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Damian L. F. earns a living by selling CDs and DVDs.. He has a small store on Figueroa street in a well-known place in the city of La Paz. He also travels to the state of Oruro to sell his merchandise. His job helps him support his family—his three children are still in school so this is the only income they have to live on. This is why he will benefit from the loan from Kiva. In his time working with [Emprender] he has shown kindness and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy DVDs

loans.name: Mariamu K.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Mariam J. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 34 and 40. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting three dependents because one is an orphan while the others' parents cannot take care of them.

Mariam has been running a genge since 2002. A genge (grocery store) is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Mariam currently earns about $20 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase sugar, rice, salt, and beans in bulk for reselling. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, salt and beans in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Kosimjon

texts.ru: Косимжон  1952 года рождения женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Он торгует луком 10 лет. До зимы у него был хороший спрос, теперь с начало весны опять опять спрос повысился на лук.  осенью все люди запасались луком и другими  продуктами. Он был доволен прошлым сбытом своего товара. До сегодняшнего времени покупка была не важной. По его прогнозу скоро будет хороший спрос.В  прошлом году он получил свой первый кредит. И благодарен что существуют такие организации как КИВА и Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Kosimjon was born in 1952, he is married and has three children. He has secondary education. He has been selling onions for ten years. Before the winter the demand for his product was high and now with the beginning of the spring and demand has grown again. In the fall everyone has stocked up on the onions and other produce. Kosimjon was satisfied with the sold inventory. Right until this point the sales were not so good. According to his prognosis the demand will grow again. Last year he has received his very first loan. He is very grateful that organizations such as Kiva and MicroInvest exist.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop business

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Аламуродов Хусейн житель города Яван. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 38 лет. Всю жизнь занимается сельским хозяйством. Сеет лук и другие виды овощей. Занимается этим видом бизнеса почти всю жизнь.Дело приносит доход , в случае если он получит хороший урожай. А это зависит от качества семян и удобрений. Поэтому он решил обратится к нам за кредитом. Деньги полученные в кредит дадут возможность купить качественные семена и удобрения. Таким образом он сможет получить качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Husan A. is a resident of the city of Yavan. He is married and has four children. He is 38 years old. He has worked in agriculture for his entire life. He plants onions and other types of vegetables. He has been in this type of business for his entire life. The business brings an income in the event that he gets a good harvest. This depends on the quality of the seeds and fertilizer. This is why he decided to turn to us for credit. Money that he receives from a loan will give him the opportunity to purchase quality seeds and fertilizer. This way he will be able to collect a high quality harvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and onion seeds

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 46 years old and comes from Zenica, one of the bigger towns in Bosnia. She lives with her mother and they support each other.

Sabina sells clothes at the big market in Zenica on most days, and when she is not there she sells them at home. She earns about 500 KM monthly, depending on the season and the weather, and it is almost enough for her.

Sabina decided to take her first loan from WWI (Women for Women International) in the amount of 1200 KM. She will use it to purchase clothes for the coming summer season.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en: Mrs. Jovencia B. is 51 years old, a widow and blessed with 6 children. She is a bonafide resident of Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She has only 1 child living with her, in school, and the rest already have their own work. Recently, she's requesting her 1st loan in the amount of 3,000 php that will be used to buy additional stock for her existing project. Her future plan for her business is widen the space at the public market and for her family is that her children will have their stable lives and independence; she is hoping to have a concrete house. She's thankful to the PMPC because they were able to provide capital and extend insurance and savings where a savings account is non-taxable.

loans.use: additional capital for her "sari-sari" (variety) store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. is a mother of one child, a son who is currently in the primary school. She is twenty seven years old and married. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

She is a seamstress by profession and trades as well. She sells crates of eggs. She supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. Esther buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy eggs in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Lean's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three women who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, led by Mrs. Lean R., who is 29 and divorced. She normally generates income of $4 per day selling different kinds of vegetables in the local busy market, having attracted many clients because she is killed in communication. To achieve even greater success, Lean would like a loan from Kiva to order extra vegetables to better meet customer demand.

The other borrowers in this group are: Lean R., a vegetable-seller requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to sell; Sok S., a vegetable-seller seeking to add to her working capital.

loans.use: To order extra vegetables.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a long-time business woman. She has been working in the beauty industry since she was 18 years old. In Columbia, where she immigrated from 8 years ago, she used the money she saved to open her own beauty salon. Six years ago, Bibiana decided to try her hand at a business in New York City. While working as a hair stylist, she began to sell perfumes and jewelry to some of her clients.

She first went to a bank to get the money she needed to start her business, but was turned away because of a lack of prior credit history. She came to ACCION USA, and because she was able to demonstrate a business cash flow, such as $3,000 from merchandise that she sold at Christmas time last year, she was approved for a small loan to purchase inventory.

With her new loan from ACCION USA, Bibiana is purchasing color pigments for applying permanent make-up to her clients. Each color pigment costs about $60 dollars. Although Bibiana continues to work as a hair stylist, her small business helps to increase her income. With this income, she has hopes to open her own store someday. Bibiana calls herself “happily divorced.” She is a single woman with an 18-year-old daughter who is optimistic about the life she can create for herself.

loans.use: To buy pigments for permanent makeup.

loans.name: Sileiloa

texts.en:
Sileiloa R. is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Faleseela. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Sileiloa operates a family member's business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Sileiloa has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 250 Samoa Tala (about $94) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sileiloa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sileiloa is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Sileiloa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a member of the Embacasy borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children,her children are aged 9,12,.16,20 years,she also cares other 4 dependents.


Theresia started her own business selling crops like maize,Tabacco 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Theresia first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this  loan Theresia hopes to get more food for family,pay school fees,ans expand her business

loans.use: To buy more crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora  Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en el centro poblado de Rosa Cami.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, ella tiene su tienda y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, azúcar, galletas, gaseosas, detergentes, golosinas, conservas, aceite, arroz, etc.

Su mayor deseo agrandar su negocio y surtirla mejor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the “Nueva Flor” (“New Flower”) Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and is the mother of 3 children. She completed her primary school education and lives in the community of Rosa Cami. Maria has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for one year. Her first loan was for 300.00 soles. She has her own store and makes a living selling groceries. This time she has asked for a loan of 800.00 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sugar, cookies, detergent, candies, canned food, oil, rice, etc. Her biggest wish is to enlarge her business and stock it better. She appreciates the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, sugar, cookies, detergent, candies, canned food, oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly G. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Beverly is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than Thol, 50, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province to earn approximately around US$3 each day, while her husband, Khit Nob, stays at home making brooms for her. Broom is made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife know how to make broom from their neighbors and they start doing that business since 1995. This couple has one school-aged child. Than told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$60 on food and US$5 on utility. Than is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to purchase a motorbike she needs to transport brooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe M. es madre soltera de un hijo y una hija y juntos como una familia unida, luchan por salir adelante y obtener un  mejor futuro.
Ella tiene establecido 2 negocios uno de ellos es la elaboración y venta de tamales cada día sábado  y los vende en Estados Unidos y  el otro negocio es una vulcanizadota establecida desde hace 2 años. Ella esta solicitando un  crédito para la instalación de 2 techos de lamina de su vivienda en construcción.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe M. is a single mother of a son and daughter who together, as a family, struggle to get ahead and have a better future. She has two enterprises going: one is making tamales which she sells on Saturdays in the United States; the other is a tire repair shop which she has had for the past two years. She is requesting funds to install two metal roofs on her house which is under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a metal roof.

loans.name: Marcia Salvadora

texts.es: Marcia Salvadora R. tiene 39 años de edad, es una mujer que tiene muchas aspiraciones en la vida. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, lamentablemente no pudo finalizar sus estudios por lo que tenía que ayudarle a su Mama en su negocio, es por esto que ella se hace cargo de este negocio al inicio tenia ciertos problemas porque no conocía muy bien a todos sus clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas y calzado. Su deseo es establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcia Salvadora R., 39, is a woman with many plans for the future. She has sold general merchandise for the past 10 years. Unfortunately, she was unable to finish her schooling because she had to help her mother in her business. For some time now she has been in charge of the work. At the beginning there were certain obstacles because she didn't know all her customers very well. The financing is for working capital to buy pants, shirts, underwear, perfumes, creams and footwear. Her wish is to set up a general store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gunsennorov

texts.en:
Gunsennorov N. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Zavkhan province in Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest son works as a carpenter and his youngest two are both university students.

N. operates a transportation service in his town. He uses his large van to transport people to his province from the surrounding provinces and back again. N. started his business in 2000 and has gained much experience and a good reputation as a driver over the years. In 2005 he used his savings to trade in his old van for a new one.

His business is very important to him and he works hard so that he can provide for his children's education. He must pay 4,500,000 tugrugs (~3100 USD) tuition each year for both of his youngest sons. It is quite expensive in Mongolia, but he says, "Education is the one thing that helps people get decent jobs and lead happy lives. For that reason, all I want is to support my son's education."

N. is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100) loan to purchase machinery parts for his van and pay a portion of his son's tuition fees.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase parts for his van and pay a portion of his son's tuition fees

loans.name: Mary Bill

texts.en:
Mary Bill P. is from the village of Purok 8, Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Mary Bill is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Bill owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used clothing and cosmetics products to local community members. Mary Bill has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Bill joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Bill is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Bill from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (used clothing and cosmetics) & working capital

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda H. is 28 years old and she lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She has three children, two of whom are attending the local school; the youngest is too little to work or study.

Chenda is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Lach Kosal, is a construction worker.

Now Chenda is applying for a loan to buy five piglets plus pig food, and to use the rest of money to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. Her husband and one of her children are in this photo with her.

loans.use: To buy five piglets, pig food and fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To strengthen her sheep-rearing business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla J. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Perla is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a fish vending business. She sells fish caught by her husband.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling seafood products in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia has three children with her husband Romeo. She does farming for a living. She and her husband spend the whole day tilling their farm. The rice farm is the only source of income her family has. 

Last year, Sylvia was able to join CEVI, a micro-finance institution (MFI) in the Philippines. She says that her first loan was a big help to her business. She particularly likes the low interest rate offered by the MFI. Now, she requests a loan of Php 11,000. With this amount, Sylvia would be able to acquire seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs her farm lacks.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora  Maria P.  tiene  45 años  de  edad  esta casada con el Señor  Sixto Reyes de 47 años,   tienen 4 hijos,  tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor  esta cursando la primaria.
    Doña Maria nos cuenta que decidieron  abrir una pequeña despensa en el año 2000, con el dinero que les enviaban sus hijos de la Argentina, aparte a esta  actividad se dedica a la venta de queso,  ya que tiene  muchas  vacas  lecheras,  con esta actividad, según nos cuenta  Doña Maria, lograron salir adelante.
   El crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercadeías varias, tales como: arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados, yerba mate, productos enlatados y otros.
Sueña que los dos hijos menores puedan llegar a ser profesionales y no emigren a otro país para conseguir trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria P. is 45 years old and married to Sr. Sixto Reyes, who is 47. They have four children, three of whom are adults while the youngest is in elementary school.

Doña Maria says she decided to open a small store in 2000 using the money her children sent her from Argentina. In addition to this business, she sells cheese since she has several dairy cows. Doña Maria says she has managed to get ahead because of these activities.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of merchandise such as rice, noodles, sugar, baked goods, “yerba mate” (a South American plant that produces leaves that are used for beverages, similar to tea leaves), canned goods, and other items. She dreams that her two youngest children will become professionals so that they do not have to migrate to another country to find work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan V. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Susan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling  products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits and candies in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Susan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeanina Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Jeanina R. B., tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 niños pequeños, su familia habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ella es doméstica y su esposo labora como chofer, proveyendo  el sustento económico a la familia, dentro de las prioridades está el mejoramiento de su hogar, pero debido a sus limitados recursos económicos, se les imposibilita el ambicionar con la idea de realizar este proyecto bajo sus propios fuentes de ingresos.

Por esta razón, solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y terminar las edificaciones de su vivienda, este apoyo servirá para la estabilidad familiar, permitiendo a sus hijos condiciones sociales más óptimas que contribuyan a su vida diaria y la satisfacción de sus padres de poderles ofrecer a ellos, un favorable nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jeanina R. B., 35, is married and has 2 small children. Her family lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla housing development. She works as a domestic and her husband works as a driver, providing the economic support to the family. One of her priorities is to make improvements to her home. However, owing to her limited economic resources, she cannot make these improvements by just relying on her own household income. For this reason, she requests a loan to purchase construction materials and finish building her home. This will support the family's stability, allowing their children to have more optimal social conditions that contribute to their daily lives, and giving the parents the satisfaction of being able to offer their children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is married with 7 children and they are in primary and secondary school respectively. She is 38 years of age and she lives with her family in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sustain her and support her husband in keeping their home.  
Lovelyn started the business 15 years ago. She said she needs extra capital in the business that will enable her increase her stock and profitability. In future she hope to have a deep freezer in her shop. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kabudsor

texts.en:
S. Kabudsor is a hardworking married woman who has three children. For the past 14 years, Kabudsor has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business when her husband's contract with a construction company ended. Without her husband’s income, bills started to pile up so Kabudsor decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Kabudsor is now requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for her family's well-being. Please help Kabudsor’s business to grow.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase office supplies for resale

loans.name: Eddiemar

texts.en:
Eddiemar P. is from the town of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Eddiemar is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Eddiemar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eddiemar has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Eddiemar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eddiemar is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Eddiemar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jose Simeon

texts.es:
Jose Simeon de 52 años de edad, labora para el Minsa desde hace 22 años, tiene dos  hijos la mayor de 18 años de edad la cual esta estudiando su segundo año en la Universidad URACCAN  y el niño menor de 14 años de edad estudia su segundo año de secundaria.   

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para realizarle un anexo a la cocina de su casa y asi tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones como todo cuidadano aspira.
                                                                                    
Don Simeon  se ha desempeñado con mucha responsabilidad en sus funciones laborales y compromisos, ya que es un cliente honesto, muy trabajador, lo ha demostrado en el pago de sus siete creditos anteriores en tiempo y forma, su mayor sueño es tener un porvenir mejor y que a sus hijos no le haga falta nada.
texts.en:
Jose Simeon is 52 years old and has worked for the ministry of public health for the past 22 years. He has two children, the eldest of whom is 18 and is in his second year at the university, and the youngest is 14 and in high school. Jose is requesting his eighth loan to build an addition in his home's kitchen and thus improve his living conditions, as anyone would want to do. He has carried out his work and commitments with great responsibility and is an honest and hard-working client, as he has demonstrated with his payments on his previous seven loan. His biggest dream is to have a better future so his kids do not lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an addition to his kitchen

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 53 años, es una persona muy luchadora, es divorciada, tiene 6 hijos pero sólo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Los deseos de brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos, mediante una actividad que le agrada mucho, motivaron a que ella, junto a sus hijos cultive plátanos y café en terrenos propios y arrendados. Ya que ellos, consideran rentable la agricultura. Además le permite solventar los gastos domésticos, pagar la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo puede ahorrar para cubrir alguna eventualidad que se le presente en el futuro. Julia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y aunque a veces le disgusta que sus plantaciones sean atacadas por algunos insectos, es perseverante y no se deja vencer, es así que a diario se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y trasladarse a su chacra, cuidar de ellas hasta que caiga la noche. Como obtiene buenas ganancias con su oficio, en adelante quiere contar con una mayor productividad, por eso plantará más café, producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasmada de saber que continuara trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para esparcirlos y nivelar la producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old and a determined individual. She is divorced and has six children, but only two of them live with her in the house that she owns. Motivated by her desire to provide an adequate quality of life for her children, she decided to pursue a business. She and her children grow bananas and coffee on their own property and on land that she has leased. Julia considers farming to be profitable since it allows her to cover the household expenses, pay for her children’s education, and set aside money for future expenses. She has been farming for 15 years and is annoyed whenever her crops are infested with insects. However, she is persistent and does not give up easily. Every day she wakes up at 5am to prepare the meals that she takes with her into the fields, where she looks after her crops until nightfall. In order to generate good income and succeed in getting the highest productivity, Julia plans to plant more coffee since it has high demand at the market.

This is her second loan with MFP. Julia has demonstrated great enthusiasm as she continues to work with the other members of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of compost to apply on her crops in order to level out production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr:
Femme couturière de 43 ans, mariée  et mère des 4 enfants dont l’age varient entre 4 et 18 ans, elle s’est  lancé dans la couture  il y a  bientôt 20ans, après sa formation elle  se spécialise dans la couture et broderie des draps des nouveaux nés.         
Elle achète des rouleaux des tissus  popelines de différents couleurs comme le rose, le bleu, le blanc et les tissus fleuris, avec sa machine elle couds 10 a 15 draps par jour et les emballe dans des sachets en plastique et va déposer les exposer dans une boutique pour les vendre.
Elle vend en moyenne 25000 Frs par jour et par moment elle livre ses draps dans les martenites de la place.
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter des rouleaux de popelines de différentes couleurs pour commencer les draps non seulement pour les nouveaux nés mais aussi des séries des lits de différente taille (single bed, King bed) pour les adultes.
Très entreprenante, elle fait la fierté de son mari et ses enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is a seamstress, 43 years old and married, the mother of four children whose ages vary between four and 18 years. She began working as a seamstress almost 20 years ago, after she finished her training. She is specialized in sewing and embroidering sheets for newborns. She buys bolts of poplins in various colors such as pink, blue, white and flowered fabric and with her sewing machine, she sews 10 to 15 sheets per day and wraps them in plastic before displaying them for sale in a shop. She makes sales of an average of 25,000 francs per day and sometimes she makes sheets for local birthing centers. With the loan she intends to buy bolts of different colored poplins in order to begin making sheets, not only for newborns but also sets of sheets in various sizes (single bed, King size) for adults. A very enterprising person, she is the pride and joy of her husband and children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of poplin to make sheets for newborns and adults

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn A., 50, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rosendo A., a tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) operator and driver. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is already working while the other is still in school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining child all the way through college. It's a dream for most Filipino parents like Jocelyn as she herself has been an elementary graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Jocelyn operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for different clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for two years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings.   

Jocelyn dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work with her business. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Zenon Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Zenón vive actualmente en la casa de su suegra con sus 3 hijos en el Zona los lotes Parada 17, su esposa se encuentra en España se fue a trabajar y buscar mejores oportunidades para ella y para su familia,  ella le ayuda con los gastos de su familia, el Sr. Zenón trabaja en el rubro hace 10 años, actualmente trabaja como chofer de la línea 38. El crédito que se le otorgo fue para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo en general. "el cliente quedo sorprendido por la rapidez que se le otorgo el crédito".
texts.en:
Zenón is currently living in his mother-in-law’s house located along stop 17, Los Lotes zone, with his three children. His wife is in Spain where she went to look for better opportunities for herself and her family. She contributes to household expenses. Zenón is a bus driver along Route 38; he’s been in this line of work for 10 years. The loan that was granted was for general maintenance and repair of his vehicle. “The client was surprised by the speed with which the loan was granted.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn C. is a married woman who lives in Paglaum, Brgy. Tabu ilog, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fish vending and operating a general store. Her husband Alejandro, who is 49 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 8 to 26 years old. Jenelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jenelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to buy fish stock for her fish vending business and more merchandise for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for home repairs. Jenelyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 54 años, esta casada con Gabriel de 59 años, producto de su amor nació Tania de 37 años; ellos viven solos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Patay. Su día la pasa cuidando su terreno de cultivo; hace ya 16 años que viene sembrando olluco, papa, arveja y maíz, el cual los vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Pero no solo a la agricultura se dedica Marina, ella también prepara comida los fines de semana en sus casa; donde instaló un pequeño restaurante desde hace 10 años; los habitantes de sus localidad, ya la conocen por su buen gusto en la cocina y no hay quien no coma sus deliciosos platos un día sábado o domingo. Ahora ella quiere tener más capital y poder dedicarse absolutamente a su negocio de comida y expandirse más. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está S. que su banco comunal la apoyará en el logro de su objetivo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arvejas y abono, ya que es la temporada donde hay mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Marina, 54 years old, is married to Gabriel, 59, and a product of their love was Tania who is 37.  They live by themselves in her own house in the locale of Patay.  Marina passes her day caring for her cultivated land.  For 16 years now she has been sowing 'olluco' (an ancient Andean tuber), potatoes, vetch (peas), and corn, which she sells in her city's central market.

But Marina isn't just involved in agriculture.  She also prepares meals on weekends in her house, where  some 10 years ago she installed a small restaurant.  She is known by residents of her locality for the good flavors of her kitchen and there is no one who fails to savor her delicious dishes on a Saturday or a Sunday.

Now Marina wants to have more capital to be able to dedicate herself absolutely to her meals business and expand it more.  This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she is certain that her communal bank will help her in achieving her objective.

With the loan Marina is requesting, she will buy vetch seeds and manure, now that it is the season of the greatest demand.

loans.use: BUYING VETCH (PEA) SEEDS AND SACKS OF MANURE FOR HER CROP

loans.name: Cherono

texts.en:
Cherono B. is a hardworking lady of 37 years who is married to Philip Tanui, a civil servant. Together they have four children aged 16 years, 13 years, 7 years and 5 years. They live in Cheplasgei Eldoret, Kenya. She has been farming (dairy farm & poultry) for the past 10 years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs. 15,000.

When she learned about KADET LTD, she joined a group and got her first loan. She had no previous history with any other MFI when she joined KADET. She repaid her fist loan well and currently she has applied for her second loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to buy more poultry chicks and a dairy cow. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to increase the number of dairy cows for dairy farming, which is also very marketable in this area.

Cherono hopes to grow her business, become the leading local investor and see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy more poultry chicks and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. R. R. Celia vive con sus tres hijos, cuenta con casa propia.
Tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Se dedica a la venta de cerdos hace mas de 10 años y requiere del préstamo para incrementar su negocio y realizar mantenimiento a sus unidades de transporte (mototaxi).
Es una persona muy trabajadora y desea invertir en el negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Celia lives with her three children and has her own house. She has worked selling pigs for more than 10 years and needs the loan to expand her business and to service her transport vehicles (moto taxi).

She has good personal and professional references, and is a very hardworking person. She wants to invest in the business to provide a better quality of life for her young children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba W. is divorced and has six dependants. She smokes fish for sale in Elmina. She has been in the fish business for 12 years. Aba uses her income to ensure the welfare of her home. This loan will be used to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her dependants’ education.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M., aged 37 years operates a salon business at Pipeline Estate. She is married to Justus Muthiani and together they have one daughter Wayua aged 11 years and in primary school. She has been running this Salon for a period of 1 years and her monthly income is Kshs 15000.

Grace was introduced to Kadet by other Kadet existing clients. Since we are approaching the Christmas holiday, Grace expects business to go up so she intends to use the loan of Kshs 30,000 to increase her stocks of weaves, hair pieces, and hair chemicals so that she is prepared in this season when business booms.  If the loan boosts the business, Grace will open another Salon and a beauty shop.

Grace dreams of being a millionaire one day with a boutique and salon in Nairobi town. She describes herself as hardworking and jovial.

loans.use: To increase stocks of weaves, hair pieces, and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en: Oyunbat B. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family have been living in their own house for the last 10 years. Her husband works as a teacher in a local school and Oyunbat operates a bakery where she sells a variety of pastries to people who live in her community. She started her own business in 2009 after working for others for many years. She is a hardworking, smart, very optimistic and hopes to expand her business further. To make this possible, she is applying for a loan for 600,000 MNT to buy more pastries and breads from a large bakery that sells its output to retail operations such as hers.

loans.use: To buy more pastries and breads from a wholesale company

loans.name: Mariposas De Endare Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA MARIPOSAS D. ENDARE PORQUE LES AGRADÓ ESE NOMBRE, ESTÁ UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DEL BARRIO SANTA MARÍA ENDARE,ESTADO D. MEXICO, EL GRUPO ESTÁ CONFORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS. LA SRA. FELIPA MANUELA T.  ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, TIENE 52 AÑOS, SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA D. ARTÍCULOS D. PAPELERÍA Y ALIMENTOS PARA ANIMALES. TIENE EN TOTAL 10 HIJOS; 7 MUJERES Y 3 HOMBRES, ACTUALMENTE 5  DEPENDEN D. ELLA, 2 ESTAN ESTUDIANDO LA PREPARATORIA, 1 LA LICENCIATURA EN LA ESCUELA NORMAL D. ATLACOMULCO, 1 LA SECUNDARIA Y 1 LA PRIMARIA. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA INVERTIR EN ALIMENTOS YA QUE POR EL PERIODO VACACIONAL NO HAY MUCHO INGRESO EN LA PAPELERÍA. AL MOMENTO D. SOLICITAR EL CREDITO LA SEÑORA FELIPA MANUELA SE SIENTE MUY ENTUSIASMADA YA QUE PODRA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA, PUES EN CONJUNTO CON SU ESPOSO HAN SABIDO SACAR A ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES LA OPORTUNIDAD D. ESTUDIAR, CON ESTA OPORTUNIDAD QUE TIENE CON EL CREDITO PRETEND. SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS HIJAS PARA QUE CULMINEN SUS ESTUDIOS Y NO DEPENDAN D. NADIE MÁS, YA QUE ESO LES PERMITIRÁ ENCONTRAR UN TRABAJO Y NO PADECER LO MISMO QUE ELLA.
texts.en:
This group is called Mariposas D. Endare because they liked the name.  It’s located in the Santa María Endare neighborhood in the state of México.  The group has 10 members.

Mrs. Felipa Manuela T. is a group member.  She is 52 years old and sells stationery supplies and animal feed.  She has a total of 10 children, 7 girls and 3 boys.  Currently, five still depend on her, two are in high school, one is studying toward a Bachelor’s in the Atlacomulco Normal School, one is in middle school and one is in elementary school.

She is asking for the loan to buy feed because during the school vacation periods the stationery shop’s sales drop.

At the moment of asking for the loan Felipa Manuela feels very enthusiastic because she’ll be able to invest in her business.  She is a very hard working person because together with her husband she’s managed to raise her children and proviD. them with the opportunity to go to school.

She intends to use the opportunity this loan gives her to continue to support her daughters so that they will finish their schooling and not be dependent on anyone since that will allow them to find a job and not have to go through what she herself has.

loans.use: For animal feed during the vacation period.

loans.name: Abdusami

texts.en:
K. Abdusami, 46, is a farmer who lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1996. He is married with 3 children. Unfortunately, Abdusami's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of 13000 Somoni to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to use on his potato crop. With the part of the loan he will also buy additional cattle for his business. Abdusami hopes the loan will allow him to increase his yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. 
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants and cattle

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Reth S., 40, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. S. sells fish, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of around $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $47 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike so that her husband can start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene sells beans and sorghum.  He is 30 years old, married and has five children who are between one and fourteen years old. Two of his children go to school. His wife works together with him. 

Damascene has been selling beans and sorghum for five years. His loan will be used to buy more beans and sorghum. He hopes to use his profits to buy a cow and his dream is to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: Buying beans and sorghum

loans.name: Birma Pilar

texts.es:
