Birma S. de 52 años, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de encebollado(se prepara con yuca y pescado, plato tipico del Ecaudor) y también vende caldo se salchicha. 

Trabaja todos los días y tiene mucha clientela. No tiene dificultades en vender su comida. Esta casada, su esposo tiene una camioneta donde hace fletes y le ayuda en su mucho en su trabajo. Birma tiene 3 hijos pero ya están casados 
Con el préstamo va a comprar pescado yuca colas para realizar mas platos de encebollados.
texts.en:
Birma S. is 52 years old and has worked all of her life selling encebollado (a traditional dish from Ecuador made with yucca and fish) and sausage soup.

She works every day and has a large clientele, so it isn’t hard for her to sell her food. She is married and her husband has a truck which he uses for transport. She helps him a lot with his work. Birma has three children but they are already married.

With the loan, she will buy fish, yucca and sodas to make more encebollado dishes.

loans.use: Fish, vegetables

loans.name: Banina

texts.fr: Dame Banina  a 48 et est mariée. Elle a 6 enfants à charge.  Elle a  reçu  de Wages un crédit qu’elle a déjà remboursé. Pour participer au foyer, elle fait le commerce  de pagnes . Elle a commencé cette activité en 1989 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend ensuite au marché de Nukafu. Elle demande un crédit pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Banina is 48 years old and married. She has six children in her care. She has already had a loan from Wages which she has repaid. In order to contribute to the household, she trades in "pagnes" (a West African term for highly decorative pieces of fabric). She began this activity in 1989 and gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. She then resells at the market in Nukafu. She is requesting a loan to get fresh supplies and satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy "pagnes"

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His farm produces milk which he sells to Brookside company, and tea which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to pay for the basic needs of his family.

Charles is 40 years old and married with 5 children who are between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood and pay school fees for his children. The lack of a stable market for his milk has been his biggest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le T. C.  is 40 years old and has two children, both of whom are in high school. She makes a living by running a shop where she sells fresh fish and meat that she procures daily from a local supplier. She earns about 100,000 VND in profit from her work. She went into business in 2005, after securing a loan from our program, and has made good use of the funds she has borrowed. She is applying for a new loan, for 8,502,000 VND, to buy equipment that will allow her to provide better service to her custmers.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a small meat and seafood business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom K. is a loving wife, and the mother of three children. She is engaged in sewing dresses. She works in an atelier of Zebo, in the street of Borbad, in Vahdat city. She sews dresses and then sells them in the market in Vahdat city.  Dilorom works very hard because she wants to earn a greater profit in order to improve their lives. Dilorom would like a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase fabrics for sewing dresses and for expanding her business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en:
Ariunzaya is 23 years old and lives with her husband and only son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She manages a household appliance trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the biggest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business with the help of her husband in 2006. 

Before starting up her business operation, she gained enough experience by working as a salesperson at her older sister's grocery booth. She has worked hard to expand and stabilize her business. She is an open-minded and diligent woman who says, "I am planning to continue my business for the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase antennas in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase antennas from Erlian.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia es cliente recurrente D. nuestra entidad, la misma vive en la ciudad D. Luque, vive en casa propia con su hija.
La titular se dedica a la costura hace más D. 10 años cuenta con buena clientela formada a la fecha, además se dedica a la venta D. ropas en forma independiente. 
La misma es cliente desD. el año 2005 y cuenta con 18 creditos cancelados en nuestra entidad. A la fecha el titular desea retirar dicha operación para la compra D. telas, ya que cuenta con una oferta y desea aprovechar la temporada D. invierno.
Dicho negocio le dejará mejores ingresos para su unidad familiar y un mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is a long-standing client of our institution.  She lives in her own home, in the city of Luque, together with her daughter.

Lidia has been in the sewing business for more than ten years and has a good, well-established customer base.  She also sells clothes independently.

Lidia has been a client since 2005 and she has repaid 18 loans with our institution.  She would like to take out a new loan to buy fabric since she has an offer and would like to make the most of the winter season.

Lidia's business will make her better income for her family and help her to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeurn resides in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She is a rice cultivator and also makes mortar of hard stone to sell. Her husband works with her in making mortar to sell as well. From this, they are able to earn about 3 USD a day. The coming rainfall is good for growing rice crops. However, Mrs. Chhoeurn doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. Thus, Mrs. Chhoeurn is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers and other family supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other family supplies

loans.name: Fotemogoban  D Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN D sont tous des femmes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et font la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide et leurs  ventes font l’objet d’une activité rentable dans la zone.
ANCHATA, qui est en deuxième position des femmes debouts en tenue  bleu, compte utiliser de façon suivante son prêt : Achat de  3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.500 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN D sont tous des femmes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 31  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et font la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide et leurs  ventes font l’objet d’une activité rentable dans la zone.
ANCHATA, qui est en deuxième position des femmes debouts en tenue  bleu, compte utiliser de façon suivante son prêt : Achat de  3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforment en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.500 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en:
Renerio is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. 

Renerio has a shop that sells a variety of products like food snacks, candies, drinks and more. He had this business for 1 year. Previously, he was involved in buying and selling of bananas. He has requested a loan to finance and sustain the mini grocery store business.

Renerio has been a member of HSPFI for the past year, since 2010. In the future, Renerio hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like food products, detergents, shampoos and more.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sofia has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and establishing a posho mill business (a mill that grinds wheat and maize into flour).

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino tiene 33 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tienen cuatro hijos y juntos residen en el centro poblado de Machente, anexo del distrito de San Francisco, donde tienen su propia casa construida a base de material rustico, adobe y techo de calamina. Faustino, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalero en distintas chacras. Con sus ahorros acumulados compró su propia parcela donde viene trabajando 05 años de manera independiente y cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y árboles maderables como el pino chuncho, caoba y entre otros.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los Ingenieros Agrónomos periódicamente. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del café por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y gracias a ello percibe buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la cosecha y desmonte de maleza. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, y por ende mejorar su condición de vida. Este será su 15avo crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su trabajo a la vez agradece y solicita el apoyo de los financistas para sobre salir adelante. En su banco comunal es un joven que aporta ideas para el progreso de su grupo comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles contratará mano ajena para que lo apoyen en las cosecha y desmonte de maleza.
texts.en:
Faustino is 33 years old.  He lives with his partner and they have four children.  They live together in the village of Machente, an annex of San Francisco district.  They own their own home which is built from 'rustic' building materials (adobe).  The roof is made from corrugated metal.

Even when he was still a teenager, Faustino worked on his parents' land.  He also worked as a laborer on other people's farms.  He saved up some money and bought his own plot of land where he has been working independently for the past five years.  He has two hectares of land planted with coffee plants and timber-producing trees such as 'pino chuncho' (a native tree), mahogany, etc.  The key to his success lies in his creativity and his desire to work.  He uses modern technology in growing his plants because he receives periodic training from agricultural engineers.

Faustino's product which is in greatest demand is his coffee beans, owing to the quality of the product that he sells.  It makes him good financial income.  Normally he works alone but during harvest times he hires laborers so that he can pick and select his product more quickly.  He will use the loan he has requested to hire laborers to support him in his harvesting and weeding.  His plan for the future is to continue expanding his production so that he can continue satisfying his customers and thereby improve his living conditions.

This is Faustino's 15th loan from MFP.  He knows that the loan will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is grateful and requests the support of Kiva lenders in helping him to get ahead.  He is a young man who contributes ideas to his community bank which help his group to make progress.  He will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles to hire laborers to support him in his harvesting and weeding.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mrs. Seak has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children. They are all enrolled in  school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Seak doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So Seak is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Seak is very grateful to all lenders that support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for farming business.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her brother’s mobile phones business. With the loan, he will buy new models of mobile phones and different mobile accessories to put to his shop to sell.
 
Parveen is 44 years old and a midwife by profession. She is unmarried and lives with her brother. She didn’t want to become a burden on her brother. That's why she started working as a midwife a few years ago. Now she is well known in her area for her services and manages her financial expenses with her earnings. 

Parveen is very confident that after investing the loan into her brother’s business, he will be able to attract more clients and make more sales.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones & mobile accessories

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 52 years old, married to James. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling ropes for the past eleven years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to buy more ropes to sell. With the anticipated profits from the business she will buy commercial land. Her hopes are to build rental houses which will help improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more ropes to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is in her forties. She is married and blessed with four children. Two are in school while the other two have temporarily stopped their education because of lack of financial means. They just finished their high school education. Daisy is peacefully living with her children and husband in the province of Isabela.

Daisy is engaged in a vending business in which she sells bitter gourd, string beans and tomatoes. Daisy wishes to increase her income to further support her family needs, hence she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell like squash, sponge gourd and eggplant to increase her sales.

Daisy is looking towards the success of her business soon.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell like squash, sponge gourds and eggplant.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат жителница района Шахритус. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе. В этой области она уже 17 лет. Кроме того Малохат занимается растениеводством. У нее при доме имеется участок земли, где она выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для покупки селитры.
texts.en: Malohat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 34 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Malohat has a higher pedagogical education.  She works at a secondary school and has been working in this field for 17 years.  Besides this work, Malohat is involved in agriculture.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Jelly has a shop that sells clothes, umbrellas & personal accessories. She is also selling snacks, beverages & viands. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of clothes & personal accessories. 
Jelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jelly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes & personal accessories

loans.name: Eda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Eda, famosa en su vecindario por sus sopas deliciosas y gustosas, habita en la ciudad de Granada, tiene 49 años edad, madre de 4 hijos, ella es comerciante, tiene una pulpería y elabora sopa los fines de semana. Ella inicio su negocio a los 25 años con una mini pulpería y venta de comida la que fue creciendo poco trabajando con pequeños créditos, lo ha ido muy bien pero ella siente que su negocio de venta de comidas (sopas, fritos) es donde mas demanda tiene de parte de sus clientes, su negocio lo tiene en su hogar en donde cada día trabaja fuerte por salir adelante y dar lo mejor en su cocina. Al igual que desea poder mejorar su pulpería la cual necesita mas productos que ofrecer.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergentes, dulces, pan, huevos, salsas, enlatados y verduras que son parte de los ingredientes que utiliza para hacer sus deliciosas sopas. Con la inversión podrá surtir su pulpería de productos de los cuales ya no tienen, y son solicitados por sus clientes además de mejorar sus ventas, y salir adelante, ya que le gustaría tener un comideria con mesas y sillas donde sus clientes se sienten a probar sus sopas, hecha por ella misma y al mismo tiempo ofrecer productos de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Doña Eda is famous in her neighborhood for her delicious and tasty soups.  She lives in the city of Granada, and is 49 years old.  She is the mother of four children and is a businesswoman; she has a general store, and makes her soup on weekends.  

She began her business at age 25 with a mini-general store and selling meals.  She was able to grow it a little by taking out some small loans.  It's gone very well for her, but she feels that her business selling meals (soup, fried foods) is where she has most customer demand.

She runs her business from her home, where she works hard every day in order to move ahead in life and to be able to do the best she can with her cooking.  She has an equal desire to be able to improve her grocery store, where she needs to offer more products for sale.

She is requesting the loan for purchasing rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergents, desserts, bread, eggs, sauces, canned goods and vegetables, which are some of the ingredients that she uses for making her delicious soups.  With the investment, she will be able to stock up her grocery store with products she doesn't currently have and those that are requested by her customers, so as to improve her sales and move ahead in life.

She would like to have an eatery with tables and chairs where her customers could sit down while they try her home-made soups, and at the same time she could offer for sale products from her general store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, desserts, bread, eggs, sauces, canned goods and vegetables, which are some of the ingredients that she uses for making her delicious soups.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 78 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children. She grows rice, earning approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice plantation. 

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to save money for when she is older.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice plantation

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Celia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras y frutas, venta de maní, venta de pasancallas, venta de comidas. 

La señora Celia  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas desde años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de frutas que comprará de La Paz y lo comercializa en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies) is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center. This group consists of 11 members and is directed by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Celia. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling fruits and vegetables, selling peanuts, selling candied popcorn, and selling food.

Sra. Celia says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation at a promotional event. She currently has a business selling fruit and has been working for several years.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory. She will buy the fruits in La Paz and then sell them in her community. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Celia is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Celia says that she enjoys the training seminars.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.es:
La señora Nora  Elia menciona que tiene poco de haber terminado de pagar el terreno en donde esta construyendo una casa pero ahora tiene detenido el proyecto por falta de dinero, es por eso que solicita un préstamo ya que prácticamente ya son los acabados del exterior y interior que es el piso de los cuartos y pintura del exterior. 
Doña Nora Elia trabaja como encargada de una tienda de ropa  y su esposo realiza trabajos de mantenimiento en ranchos desde cuatro año, y desean ir realizando los mejoramientos que sean necesarios a su vivienda, tiene dos hijos uno de seis años que esta estudiando la primaria y un bebe de un años de edad. 
Desean mejorar y tener seguro el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nora Elia says she has almost finished paying for the land on which she is building a house, but now the project is on hold due to lack of money. She is asking for a loan for the exterior and interior finish work, which is the floor of the rooms and the exterior paint. 

Nora Elia works as a manager in a clothing store, and her husband has done maintenance work on ranches for four years. They want to continue making necessary improvements to their house. They have two children, a six-year-old who is in primary school and a one-year-old baby. 

They want to improve and secure the inheritance of their children.

loans.use: perform finish work on the exterior and interior of her house

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela cuenta con 33 años de edad y está casada con el señor Roberto con quien tiene 2 hijos, Alexis y marco Antonio quienes están cursando tercer año de secundaria y sexto año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 2 años.
Dice que se animo a iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, para mejorar su calidad de vida, apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y hacerse de una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: aceite, pastas para sopa, arroz, refrescos, leche, galletas, focos, jabón, clarasol, etc. para tener un mejor surtido. 
Una de las metas que dice tener doña Carmen (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio, es la de invertirle mucho mas, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas su pequeño local y poner su abarrotería, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ganancias, también empezar a ahorrar parte de las mismas, para asegurar su futuro junto al de su familia.
Doña carmen está muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por todo el apoyo y sobre todo confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en:
Carmela is 33 years old and married to Roberto.  They have two children, Alexis and Marco Antonio, who are in their third year of high school and sixth year of primary school.  She has had a grocery store for two years.

She says that she started this business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses, improve her quality of life, support her children with their studies, and become more solvent.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise such as oil, pastas for soup, rice, drinks, milk, cookies, light bulbs, soap, and other items to have a better sock.

Carmen (as she is better known in her community) says that one of her goals for her business is to invest in it much more to make it grow quickly.  She wants to expand her small space and open a real grocery store so that she can earn a better income.  She is also starting to save part of her income to assure her family's future.

Carmen is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all of their support and the confidence they have in her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as oil, pastas for soup, rice, drinks, milk, cookies, light bulbs, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Hork

texts.en: Hork, 30, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Hork rents bicycles to tourists, and his wife sells seafood. Hork is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work in the town. By doing so, his family is able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to expand his grocery business. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her her husband to commute to work in the town

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena owns a spa business that specializes in beauty services. She came from Columbia and opened the business over 3 years ago, with a dream and excitement to enter the beauty business which is constantly reinventing itself. She decided to become an entrepreneur by providing her clients with spa services such as massages, waxing, facials, body wraps and scrubs. She has one employee assisting with the spa. Lorena’s business is operated out of a storefront, and she has built her clientele over the years mostly through word of mouth. Now, she is hoping to gain capital for advertising and marketing. The biggest challenge for the business has been finding innovative strategies to expand and compete with the ever-changing industry. 

This loan will be used to purchase a facial/massage bed and three machines used for facials and wraps. It will also pay for new advertising for the business. This will help Lorena keep up with new trends in the industry and expand her clientele base.

loans.use: to purchase a massage bed and facial/wrap machines for her spa.

loans.name: Zenas

texts.es:
Zenas de 47 años convive con Cristina con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo vive con 2 de ellos de 20 y 18 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa San Román Bajo, en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Zenas es un hombre agricultor. En todos sus años como padre ha trabajado con esmero sembrando café, plátanos y yucas. Ahora cuenta con 13 parcelas de terrenos donde los produce en mayor cantidad.
“Tenía 10 años trabajando con una cooperativa, pero ahora trabajo para particulares quienes pagan más por el kilo de café”, menciona.  Zenas comenta que se invierte demasiado en el abono, ya que sus sembríos necesitan fertilizantes 2 veces al año.
Es por ello que recibe el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes distribuyen su tiempo para no descuidar sus otras labores.
Ahora sus hijos estudian y no les falta mucho para que independicen, por ello Zenas espera ahorrar una cantidad de dinero para vivir tranquilamente con su esposa, sin necesidad de derrochar muchas fuerzas. Sería la primera vez que él recibiría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “La Bella Durmiente” es el nombre de su banco comunal, menciona que será constante y participativo en las actividades del grupo. De obtener el dinero, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abonos que oscilan entre 120 y 130 soles. Tiene pensado comprar  10 sacos.
texts.en:
Zenas, 47, lives with is common-law wife, Cristina, and two (ages 20 and 18) of their four children.  They live in their own house in the native community of San Román Bajo in the district of Perené, province of Chanchamayo.  Zena is a crop farmer and since becoming a father has worked hard growing coffee, bananas and yucca plant.  Now he has 13 patches of land where he grows these crops in more quantity.  "I worked for ten years with a co-op but now I work for private businesses who want to pay more per kilo for coffe.", he says.  Zenas claims he spends too much on fertilizert because the crops need it twice a year.

That's why his children help out, distributing their time so as not to neglect their other jobs.  His children are now studying but soon will become independent, so Zenas hopes to save a bit of money to live quietly with his wife and not have to work too hard.  This is his first loan through MFP and he is committed to pay it back on time.  "La Bella Durmiente" (Sleeping Beauty) is the name of his communal bank.  He says he will be persistent and participatory in the group's activities.  He plans to use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer which cost between 120 and 130 PEN.  He wants to buy 10 sacks.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en: Philippe is aged 36. He has three children aged between 3 and 7, and all of them attend schools. He has been supplying fruits at schools for the last six years. He has requested the loan to buy more fruits to supply the schools because the demand is high. He will save the profits, simply because he wants to become a more competent supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for supplying schools.

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es:
Los sueños de Kelly Johana siempre fueron estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas o Diseño Gráfico en una de las instituciones más reconocidas, estudio una de las ramas de la ingeniería de sistemas, la cual es Programación de software, luego de dos años no decidió seguir con lo que tuviera que ver con sistemas, pues en ese corto tiempo se dio cuenta que realmente no tenía la suficiente paciencia para ello.

Una tarde Kelly Johana empezó a buscar universidades en otro país donde estuviera una carrera de diseño gráfico, pues cuando pequeña siempre le gustaba el arte, en diseño se trataba de dibujar, quería seguir los ideales, encontró una gran oportunidad de estudiar en Buenos Aires (Argentina) pues para nadie es un secreto que en ese país la educación es mucho más barata que en Colombia, le comento a los familiares y aunque algunos se le burlaban del quererse ir a estudiar a otro país ella quiso seguir, ellos terminaron por aceptarlo pues no les quedaba de otra.

Un día la madre fue a inscribir a la hermana a un instituto para que ella estudiara lo que siempre había querido, en ese instituto le daban la posibilidad de estudiar también otras carreras en ellas encontró arte gráfico y publicitario le comento a Kelly Johana y ella decidió ir a averiguar. En el momento en que le dijeron de que trataba este técnico le pareció buena idea, pues podía prolongar algunos semestres en la universidad de Argentina en donde va a estudiar decidió estudiar allí pues sabía que a la hermana le podía ayudar para que le bajara un poco el costo de la matrícula.

En el día en que Kelly Johana se matriculo le comentaron sobre el subsidio que ofrecía kiva, que le podían subsidiar con una parte de lo que ella paga mensual en la carrera, entonces hace todo a al alcance para poder estudiar en el instituto y pagar un poco menos en la carrera. Hasta el día de hoy Kelly Johana está muy contenta en la carrera y espera conseguir alguna ayuda para que pueda pagar un poco menos y a la madre no le quede muy pesado pagar el valor de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Kelly Johana always dreamed of studying Computer Engineering or Graphic Design at any of the most recognized institutes. She studied something related to Computer Engineering: Programming. After two years, she decided to stop studying anything related to computers because she realized that she is not patient enough.

One evening, Kelly Johana started to look for universities abroad that offered education in Graphic Design. As a girl, she liked art and design. She wanted to pursue her goals and found a good opportunity to study in Buenos Aires (Argentina). Everyone knows that it is cheaper to study there than in Colombia, so she told her relatives and although some of them made fun of her because she wanted to study abroad, she was persistent and her relatives just had to accept it.

One day, her mother was registering Johana’s sister for the program she always wanted to study and realized that the institute offered different programs, among them Graphic Arts and Advertising. She told Johana and she decided to ask. When they told her what the program was about, she thought it was a good idea. She could postpone her studies in Argentina for a while because she knew that her sister could help her to get reduced tuition fees.

When Johana registered, she was told that she could receive help through Kiva and that she could get some additional subsidies. She is trying hard to be able to study here and pay a reduced fee. So far, Kelly feels satisfied with her studies and hopes to receive more help with her tuition fees, so that her mother does not have to work so hard every month to be able to pay them.

loans.use: to pay one semester's tution fee.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married; she is 48 years old and has four children. Three of her children have completed high school, whereas the other one is still in Form Three.

Mary has been a member of Gondo Rehab Women group since 2003. She has been using small loans from the group and repaid all the 4 loans she borrowed. These small loans have been assisting her to pay school fees for her children. Mary sells used and new shoes (both men's and women's shoes) in a business she started in 2002.

It has been progressing ever since it was started and it’s the main income generating activity that she has. In one month, she makes an average of about $100 per month and this supports the whole family. But she would like to increase her supply to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: Mary would like to buy a bale of used shoes to be ready for the festive season.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Margret is 36 years old with two children. The first born is in Primary 6 and the second born in Primary 2. She is also supporting four orphans i.e Primary three, Primary five,Primary three, Senior two and Senior four. Through her meagre income she was able to support her young brother at the University college and obtained a Diploma in Business Administration.

Margret was working at a Baptist book store which  closed in 2000 due to stiff competition. She decided  to start her own business using the experience she acquired from her formal employment.

She started a stationary buisiness with a loan from   SAO MFI of  US $173. She later diversified her business with other items like home utensils.

She wants to expand her business with a loan of US $ 1150. She wants to expand the business by binding books and start supplying stationery to education institutions.

She wants to create employment opportunities for the family members as the business expands.

loans.use: To increase business stock

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika is 34 years old and the mother of six children. Monika’s husband has a steady income from his job as a night watchman in a local hotel, however, Monika felt she should share equally in the financial management of their large family and subsequently joined SPBD; she now runs a small taro and fruit plantation and sells her products at a small stand to local villagers. Monika dreams of being able to save enough to build a proper house for her children and admits to being ashamed of her small, open Samoan house. Monika readily praises the financial support she received from the micro-loan programs and believes with further reinvestment in her business and hard work, she can reach her dreams. In the meantime, she will use part of her requested loan funds to make some much-needed repairs to the roof of her home.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, weed killers and perform home improvements

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora Alicia is married with three children, ages 2, 5, and 7. Her husband works in a tire shop, but his lack of responsibility for his family have made it very difficult for Dora and her children to have basic necessities such as food, clothing, and an education. In order to not depend as much on her spouse, and to give her children what they need, Dora began selling cosmetics, clothing, shoes and jewelry from her home four years ago.

Fortunately, Dora’s sales have grown from the beginning, and once she saw that her clients liked her products, she decided to open a spot in a market with additional and better quality merchandise. In order to stock her business, she is asking for a $275 loan which she has agreed to pay in 3 months. You can help her by contributing to the growth of this business, and to a better quality of life for this family. They thank you for your trust and assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora Alicia es casada y tiene tres hijos de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una vulcanizadora pero su falta de responsabilidad para con su familia han logrado que Dora y sus hijos tengan serios problemas para obtener lo necesario para poder vivir bien, como alimentos, vestido y educación. Para no depender tanto de su pareja y poder ofrecerle a sus hijos lo que necesitan, Dora inició con las ventas de cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y joyería desde hace cuatro años en su propio hogar.

Afortunadamente sus ventas han mejorado desde que inició y al ver que sus productos eran bien aceptados por sus clientes, decidió establecerse en un mercado con mayor mercancía y de mejor calidad. Para poder surtir bien su negocio solicita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 3 meses. Decídete a apoyarla, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te agradecen mucho tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Audelith

texts.es:
Business Description

Doña Audelith is dedicated to sell refreshing beverages like: water, flavored waters, different colas and others. She has been working on this type of activity for 4 years. Her business is located at her home and she tends to it from 8 am until 8 p.m. every day of the week. Thanks to this effort she has been able to maintain and continue her business.

Loan Use

Audelith needs the loan to provide her business with facilities where the customers can sit. Most of the loan will be invested on tables and chairs. Also, due to the volume that her business has reach in terms of customers, Audelith is in need of expanding her business to serve her customers in a comfortable place and keep them happy.

Personal Information

Presently, Audelith is 46 years old and lives with her husband. Her husband is a great help for her at the business as well as in the house. They also have 2 grown-up children that don't live with them because they are independent. Audelith's hopes to move her business forward and expand it more. That way she can increase her capital for her own benefit and progress and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Audelith se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescantes como: aguas, colas en diferentes presentaciones y también bebidas refrescantes. Teniendo como experiencia 4 años, trabajando en este tipo de actividad, ya que el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio atendiendo desde las 8am hasta las 8pm, todos los días de la semana, en la que gracias a su propio esfuerzo a podido mantenerse en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Audelith necesita el préstamo para adecuar el negocio, en lo que tiene que ver con la compra de utensilios como sillas y mesas. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Audelith se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, para de esa manera tener a sus clientes conformes y contentos.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Audelith tiene 46 años de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposo que le es gran ayuda en el hogar y en el negocio también, además tienen 2 hijos pero ambos de mayoría de edad, pero no viven con ellos ya que son independientes. Los anhelos de Audelith es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar y progreso de si misma.

loans.use: Invest on tables and chairs so her customers can sit and enjoy their refreshments.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sueli

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Sueli, is 49 and a mother, She has a stall selling tidbits and gado-gado ( a type of local delicacy) located at Manistutu town. Sueli started her business 5 years ago with a capital of Rp 500.000. Initially she started selling only gado-gado, but with her diligent hardwork, she has increase to cater other varieties as well. She start from 7 in the morning and ends at 9pm in the evening. Sueli reaps a profit of Rp 65.000, mainly from her gao-gado sales, because she has regular customers for them. However she is unable to cope with the demand due to lack of cash flow. With the financial help from Dinari, Sueli has increase her varieties to cater drinks and other necessities as well. Now she has more profit then before and is very thankful, because it has it has increase the wellness of her family.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Sueli seorang ibu yang sudah berusia 49 tahun, mempunyai usaha warung makanan ( Menjual gado-gado, es dan makanan ringan ) yang berlokasi di desa Manistutu. Sueli memulai usahanya sejak 5 tahun lalu dengan modal Rp 500.000,- . Menjual Gado - gado ( makanan yang terbuat dari ketupat yang dicampur sayuran dengan bumbu kacang ) adalah awal mulainya usaha warung Sueli. Karena ketekunannya berusaha, kini warung kecil itu telah berubah menjadi sebuah warung cukup besar untuk ukuran di desanya dengan jenis makanan yang lebih bervariasi. Memulai buka warung dari pukul 07:00 pagi sampai dengan pukul 21:00 malam, Sueli mampu meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp 65.000,- terutama dari penjualan gado - gadonya yang memiliki rasa yang khas dan banyak di sukai oleh para pelanggan. Usaha Sueli berkembang dengan cepat karena makananya enak dan di dukung juga tempat yang bersih dan yang tak kalah pentingnya juga harganya yang bersaing . Karena usahanya sudah memiliki banyak pelanggan, Sueli merasa kewalahan untuk melayani permintaan pelanggannya karena usahanya kekurangan modal. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, sekarang Sueli sudah melengkapi variasi dagangannya dengan berbagai jenis makanan / minuman ringan dan juga barang –barang kebutuhan sehari - hari lainnya sehingga semua kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia. Sekarang ini, Sueli mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak dari sebelumnya dan Sueli merasa sangat bersyukur, karena hal itu dapat meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use: Melengkapi fasilitas warungnya dengan menyediakan aneka jenis barang kebutuhan sehari-hari,mulai dari makanan dan minuman ringan sampai keperluan untuk dapur - To increase facilities of her stall and add more varieties of food and drinks.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mrs. Khuon S. N., age 29, works selling grocery products at her home, making on average about $8 each day in revenue. Her husband is a soldier making $3 per day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more grocery products to diversify her inventory to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Farasta

texts.en: My name is Farasta B. and I'm from Lahore, a large metropolis in Pakistan. I am a widow with three children, all of whom are married. I live in a joint family with my sons and their wives. One of my sons is a tailor. He needs to buy a few sewing machines for his shop and would like a loan of $175. With this loan, he hopes to establish a more successful business.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
When Dionisia Moved to San Juan de Lurigancho, she realized that in her new neighborhood they were no stores. That’s why for the last ten years she has a store in which she doesn’t only sells drinks, candies and snacks, she also sells bread, fruits and vegetables.

It wasn’t easy at the beginning, Dionisia had a small house and her business was a little kiosk right next to her house and she sold her bread door to door. Thanks to the support of EDAPROSPO she managed to expand her store and with the income of her business she helped her husband build a new house.

If she obtains the loan she wants to expand her store or build a bookstore / bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando Dionisia se mudó a San Juan de Lurigancho, se dio cuenta que no había una tienda por su barrio. Es por eso, que desde hace 10 años tiene una tienda en la que no solo vende abarrotes, gaseosas y golosinas; sino también, panes, frutas y verduras.

No fue fácil al inicio. Dionisia tenía una casa precaria por lo que su tienda era un pequeño kiosco al lado y el pan lo vendía de puerta en puerta. Gracias al apoyo de EDAPROSPO pudo implementar su tienda y con los ingresos que ésta le ha dado ha ayudado a su esposo a construir su casa.

De tener un financiamiento, a Dionisia le gustaría ampliar su tienda o poner una librería- bazar.

loans.use:
Open a bookstore/bazaar

Poner una librería/bazar

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Señora Nelida is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women), located at Jr Coronel Portillo No. 836 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 34 years old, has a daughter, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business of buying and selling telephone cards.

Presently she has a table that she uses to sell sweets, and at the same time she still sells her phone cards and is overseeing the installation of a business of internet booths. Together with her only daughter they share the household chores and the work for the sweets table.

With the loan of 2000 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest in the construction of internet booths and purchasing telephone cards.

Nelida is a very hardworking woman. With her earnings from selling sweets and with the loans from Manuela Ramos, she was able to save enough to be able to install the internet booths. It was a dream that she's had in her mind for a long time and finally it is being realized through much effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 836, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años, una hija y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de tarjetas telefónicas.

En la actualidad tiene un tablero de venta de golosinas y a la vez vende sus tarjetas y está viendo la implementación y acondicionamiento de un local para cabinas de internet. Junto con su única hija de distribuyen las labores domésticas y la atención de su tablero.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la construcción de cabinas de Internet y en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas.

Nelida es una mujer muy trabajadora. Con las ganancias obtenidas de su venta de golosinas y con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para poder poner las cabinas de internet. Era un sueño que desde mucho tenia en mente y que por fin lo está realizando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Construction of internet booths

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a young father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture tasks for the past 8 years, cultivating potatoes, beans, and forage crops for animals. His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits, so that his three children can continue their education. Antonio has dreamed of extending his lands and wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva voluntter.

Antonio es un joven padre de familia que durante 8 años se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas de manera independiente cultivando así la papa, habas y también forraje para el alimento de animales, los esfuerzos que realiza diariamente y el cuidado de sus campos aseguran una buena cosecha y también las ganancias para que sus 3 hijos sigan estudiando, Antonio tiene el sueño de extender sus terrenos y desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en sus terrenos actuales a fin de obtener mayores ganacias para cumplir la meta que se ha trazado.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Maria Elizalda

texts.es:
Maria is married and has 2 children. She started her business because she wanted a career that would help her husband. She decided to enroll in beauty school. She began in her house 16 years ago as an apprentice to another person, developing her own style, until she was ready to go out on her own.

She's applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy a new chair and remodel her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María es casada y tiene 2 hijos, inició su negocio por que siempre quiso aprender una profesión para apoyar a su esposo y decidió meterse a la escuela de belleza. Comenzó hace 16 años en su casa como aprendiz con otra persona hasta poner su estética para únicamente ver a sus clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un sillón nuevo y remodelar parte de mi negocio como la fachada y pintura en general.

loans.use: Improve shop.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia B., wife of Z. I., is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Safia and her husband did not have the opportunity to pursue an education in their childhood, but they wish to give their children an opportunity to go to school and pursue their careers. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Her husband is a auto-rickshaw driver as well as a baker at a local hotel. She would like to apply for a loan to pay the remaining two installments of the auto-rickshaw.

Her loan group members include: Allah Rakhi B. who wants to start a milk business; Anwar B. who wants to buy rickshaw; Bashiran B. who wants to start an ice business; and Rafia B. who wants to start a seasonal wheat business.This is loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To buy for an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a 45 year old entrepreneur. She is married and lives with her family in Nyamasaria Kisumu, Kenya. She runs a grocery stall that she initiated in 1985. She has received three microfinance loans from KMET. She owes her success to KIVA/KMET partnership. Benta has requested for $400.00 to enable her add more stock to her store.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ms. Trang's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Trang (MS: 09050048), is 57 years old. Ms. Trang’s group has finished paying back the loan of the first round. In the next round of loan, Ms. Trang would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to invest into breeding pigs.

In her group:

-Ms. N. Thi Muon (MS: 09050049), would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to breed silkworms.

-Ms. N. Thi Nga (MS: 0900050), would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to invest into her carpentry business.

-Ms. N. Thi Loan (MS: 09050047) would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to breed poultries.

-Ms. C. Thi Xuyen (MS: 09050046) would like to borrow 3.808.000 VND to breed poultries (chickens and pigs)

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Cô Ngô Thị Trang (MS: 09050048), năm nay 57 tuổi. Cả nhóm cô đã tham gia C. kỳ I và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Lần này tham gia C. kỳ II cô vay 3.808.000 VND để phát triển chăn nuôi lợn.

Trong nhóm cô còn có:

  • Nguyễn Thị Muộn (MS: 09050049), vay 3.808.000 VND để nuôi tằm làm tơ.
  • Ngô Thị Nga (MS: 09050050), vay 3.808.000 VND để phát triển nghề mộc.
  • Ngô Thi Loan (MS: 09050047), vay 3.808.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • C. Thị Xuyên (MS: 09050046), vay 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi bò, lợn.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana kosar baji is the wife of A. M. and a mother of one 10-year-old son, Husnain. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Her husband runs a cigarette shop. He buys cigarettes from markets and sells them in his community. He has been in this profession for the last 8 years. Rehana baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy more cigarettes to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy Islamic religious books for her bookshop. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy more wheat to resell. Ramzan baji wants a loan to buy rice and wheat to resell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy crockery for their food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cigarette inventory

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan M. is a 37-year-old man who raises cows and sells dairy products to the local people and factories. He is married and has 2 sons. As he grew up in a farmers' family from the beginning of his life, he has learned how to raise, breed, and sell dairy cows and other livestock.

Aslan would like to expand his business and purchase an additional cow for US$ 600, one calf for US$ 300, and fodder. The purpose is to expand his business and improve the life of his family. He is working for this aim very hard and hopes that his loan will help him and make his financial income more stable.

loans.use: to purchase one cow, one calf, and fodder

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 37 años, tiene 3 hijos que están cursando estudios secundarios, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales desde el primer momento en que se vino a vivir en su asentamiento humano, le va muy bien, ya que es la única que vende este producto. Tiene también a su esposo Javier, quien siempre lo apoya en todo y  está de acuerdo con lo que se propone. Ahora tiene el deseo de seguir creciendo en su negocio, y posteriormente alquilar un local o mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus productos, pero para esto ella estima de un capital para poder lograr lo que realmente quiere. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old and has three children in high school. She makes a living selling regional vegetables since the first moment she came to this settlement, and it has gone very well since she is the only one who sells these products. Her husband, Javier, always supports and agrees with her goals. Currently, Rosario hopes to keep growing her business and later rent a storefront or pay for a kiosk to be built for her to sell her products. But she needs more capital to really achieve what she wants. With your help this mother will make headway in no time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of regional vegetables she sells

loans.name: Tinh

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Tính 32 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Khác với nhiều chị em phụ nữ khác ở vùng nông thôn chị sống đơn thân không đi xây dựng gia đình do vậy lúc trước khi chưa vào Quỹ chị không biết làm gì để tăng thu nhập.Chị đã được giới thiệu vào Quỹ Tình Thương khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã có cơ hội vay vốn và học tập các chị em khác trong việc kinh doanh và buôn bán. Sau 10 năm tham gia quỹ chị đều vay vốn đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, công việc kinh doanh của chị diễn ra thuận lợi đến nay chị đã có 1 của hàng tạp hóa khang trang với nhiều loại mặt hàng khác nhau. Thu nhập từ cửa hàng bình quân 150.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 12.000.000đ mua thêm hàng hóa
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Tinh is 32 yrs old; and joined the TYM fund in 1997. Unlike other women living in the countryside, she has never married and, therefore, before joining the fund she did not know what to do to increase her income. When she joined the fund, she was able to learn from the other women in the group the business and commerce skills. After 10 years in the fund borrowing money and investing in a grocery store, her business did quite well and she now has a spacious store selling a variety of products. Average income from the store is 9 USD per day. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 725 USD to purchase additional merchandise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Abel

texts.fr: Né vers 1978 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur   A. Abel est marié et père de 4 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 140 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Mr. Abel A. was born around 1978 in the KESSOUNOU district of DANGBO village. He is married and the father of four children, one of whom attend school. He is a farmer in GLAHOUNSA village in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the HOUEDOME group GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. The inhabitants of this village work the land after the fall of the level of the Ouémé river. Their land is rich and offers a high yield. Their main activity is growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these riverside residents is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. When the river level drops they do not have any money left to pay for the workforce essential for sowing the available land. The local practice of selling cheaply the harvest does not provide them with financial security and further bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person in order to have the required money to continue farming. Tired of this practice, they are requesting a loan of 140 000 FCFA (USD 275) to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned land.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exploitation 1,5hectares  du maïs, du piment

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira se dedica a la costura de prendas de mujer (vestidos, faldas, blusas y arreglos en general).
Vive en la zona de villa san Antonio bajo de la ciudad de La Paz, en alquiler.
Está separada de su esposo y tiene una hija que está a su cargo.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela, encaje, hilo, forros y botones)
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con buen cumplimiento en el pago de su crédito.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Elvira makes a living sewing clothing for women (dresses, skirts, blouses and general alterations). She lives in the Villa San Antonio zone, down from the city of La Paz. She rents. She is separated from her husband and has a daughter in her care. The loan is for the purchase of raw materials (cloth, lace, thread, lining material and buttons). This is her fourth loan from Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a #1 customer, meaning that she has complied with the terms of repayment. Her desire to work gives her the opportunity to be able to request this loan, she is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread, lining, buttons for her dressmaking business of women's clothing.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en: Mrs. Savin M. was born in 1964 and lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Savin M. is a widow with two children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. The rice revenue she earns from her small plot of land is not enough to sufficiently support her family. She is requesting a loan to help her feed her family during a time of short rice supply.

loans.use: To purchase food for her family

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia E. is 24 years old and married to Frederick, a ferryboat operator. They have a four year old son named John Gerald. The couple is helping one another in providing the daily needs of their family and saves some of their income in preparation of their son’s education.  

Their sole source of income is their ferry boat that transport passengers from their village to the town proper of Ilagan crossing the Cagayan River.  Nelia supported her husband in their business and for now she is asking for financial support to the lenders amounting to PHP4,000.  The loan will be used to repair their boat and hopefully start in the vending business of snacks or vegetables for them to have an increase in income.  She hopes to pursue her business plans and ambitions for her family especially for their child’s future.

loans.use: Boat repair

loans.name: Sous

texts.en: Sous S., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo, Cambodia. She works as a weaver and makes US$3 per day, while her husband earns US$3 a day working as a taxi driver. This couple has no children yet. Sous S. would like to take out a loan to purchase silk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Mafoe Sunana

texts.en: Mafoe Sunana S., 24, is married with four children.  She has two years of experience in the ice cake and piggery farm business. She sells to the villagers seven days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 62 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Mafoe Sunana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase wire for fence, cement, sugar, cordial and foam cups.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.fr: Hassane S. est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il gère un magasin de pièces détachées dans un quartier populaire de Lomé. Il détient cette activité depuis 3 ans. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, Hassane désire accroitre la taille de son activité  en alimentant sa boutique. Il compte faire des livraisons en gros afin de donner à son commerce une renommée et accroître par conséquent ses recettes. Il souhaite avec cette opportunité améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Hassane S., 36, is married and the father of one child. He runs a spare parts store in a working class neighborhood in Lomé. He has had this business for 3 years. With this second loan from FECECAV, Hassane hopes to expand the size of his business by stocking it more fully. He intends to make wholesale deliveries so as to make his business well-known and thus increase his sales. He hopes to use this opportunity to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding the inventory of his store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a son. According to her, her son has completed senior high school and has yet to continue. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Mary works very hard to provide for her son. She is a petty trader. She fries doughnuts and supplies them to retailers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Accra. She also runs a provisions store and sells charcoal on a table top in front of the store. Mary has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her son the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to make cooked food

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa F. is forty two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. She says some are in the junior high school while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Theresa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge. She prepares the porridge in her house of residence and sells it in her community in the mornings. Theresa procures bags of maize from the nearby communities. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 1 año y otro de meses de nacido. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas de la agricultura, actualmente lo hace en las tierras de cultivo que ha heredado; produce principalmente la papa, junto a su esposo siembran en pequeñas cantidades para luego hacerla secar al sol y que así sirve como ingrediente básico en la preparación de un plato típico de su zona. Con las ventas obtenidas han podido crecer económicamente y reunir un capital considerable para iniciarse, hace 3 meses, en la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, lo cual es un ingreso económico adicional para su familia. Hasta el momento estas actividades le han resultado rentables porque siempre tiene clientes que consumen estos  productos. Maribel ve el futuro con grandes opciones de desarrollo, pues quiere incrementar la cantidad de papa que siembra y tener una granja de animales más  grade y bien equipada. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, debido a la información que obtuvo sobre la dinámica de trabajo de un banco comunal ha decidido formar parte de uno, de manera muy comprometida. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más cuchillos para el pelando de la papa, así como también adquirirá más cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
23-year old Maribel lives in her mother’s house together with her husband and their two children—the elder is 1 year old and the younger just a few months old. Ever since she was a young girl, Maribel has worked in agriculture, and she now farms land that she inherited. Her principal crop is potatoes; she and her husband grow them in small quantities which are then dried in the sun. The dried potatoes form the main ingredient in a local dish. With the sales of the potatoes they have been able to make financial progress and save enough capital to start, three months ago, raising young animals such as guinea pigs and chicks. This endeavour has provided a further economic boost for the family. Their farming activities have always been profitable because there are always customers to eat these products. Maribel sees a number of development options for the future: she wants to increase the quantity of potatoes that she grows and also to have a bigger, well-equipped farm. This is the first time she has asked for a loan with Kiva partner MFP. Because of the information she obtained about how a community bank worked, she decided to become a member and get involved. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy more knives for peeling the potatoes, and more guinea pigs and chicks.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy knives and young animals

loans.name: Sayi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sayi S. from Mwanza.  She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 16 years old. Sayi has been running a pharmacy business since 2007. Her business is to sell human medicine for treatment. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sayi currently earns about 260USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase medicine in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve her business. Sayi thanks you for your support!

ABUOT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Fabiola Haide

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola HaiD. es casada con el señor Marco Antonio quien trabaja para una empresa en el área D. mecánico desD. hace 18 años.
Juntos forman una familia muy unida, estable y trabajadora. 
Ella es líder y vendedora D. una línea D. joyería, cosméticos, bisutería, etc. sus ventas son através del catalogo D. pedidos así ella no solamente siempre esta al pendiente D. su familia y del hogar sino que además obtiene otros ingresos que contribuyen con el apoyo económico familiar, este es el motivo por el cual se esta tramitando este crédito, para realizar una inversión en este negocio practico, e incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiola HaiD. is married to Mr. Marco Antonio, who has worked for a mechanics company for 18 years. Together they form a tight-knit family, stable and hard-working. She is a leader and seller of a line of jewelry and cosmetics that she sells through catalog orders, through which she does not always just look after her family and the home but can also obtain some income that contributes to the family's economic support. This is the motivation for processing this loan to make an investment in this business practice and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a business

loans.name: Noemi Carla

texts.es: La cliente es soltera  ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, hace un año ya que tiene la farmacia,  donde le va muy bien, es por eso que necesita del credito para poder surtir su farmacia; ella es del Departamento de Potosi, se vino a estudiar y se quedo a trabajar en su profesion que es Bioquimica, ayuda a dos hermanos menores que estan estudiando en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Our client is a single woman who has demonstrated responsibility in making her payments. She has been running her own pharmacy for a year now. She has been very prosperous, but she now needs a loan in order to restock her pharmacy. She is from the department of Potosi, where she came to study and stayed to work in the Biochemistry field. She is helping her younger siblings who are now attending the university.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Bibi Sheren Group

texts.en: Bibi Sheren is the group leader of Bibi Sheren group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to grow their businesses and make them larger. They have requested a group of loan 40,000 Afghani. Bibi Sheren wants to take a loan for the business of quilt making. Gul Ghati wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Sharefa wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store. Salia wants to take a loan for a bakery. They are very happy for this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To grow their businesses (quilt making, tailoring, general store, bakery)

loans.name: Benedicta Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Benedicta Irma M. es soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona, viven en una casa propia la cual estan terminando de construir.

La Sra. Benedicta se dedica a la actividad lechera desde hace 15 años, entrega diariamente toda su produccion a una empresa que produce toda clase de productos lacteos. 

esta oportunidad no la quieren desaprovechar debido a que requieren dinero para terminar de construir su vivienda y mejorar la condicion de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta Irma M. is single and has 2 children who attend school in the area. They live in their own home, which is in the final stage of construction.

Sra. Benedicta has been a dairy farmer for 15 years. She delivers milk on a daily basis to a company that produces all types of dairy products.

She did not want to miss this opportunity to take advantage of a loan, so she will use the money to finish construction of her house so that she can improve the living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of her house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
