María es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 28 años y vive al lado de su esposo y su pequeña hija, la cual lamentablemente sufre de un mal al corazón. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en compañía de su esposo, ambos trabajan día a día para brindarle a su hija una buena calidad de vida. Pero algunas veces, la pequeña sufre de recaídas, por lo cual deben ir frecuentemente al medico, es por ello que María usualmente no permanece en su puesto de venta, dejándole las riendas a su esposo (quien aparece en la foto), quien sabe administrar muy bien el negocio en su ausencia. A ambos les gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que les permite ser independientes y lograr generar sus propios ingresos económicos. Para el futuro esperan tener un local adecuado con el que puedan aumentar sus ingresos para darle a su pequeña esperanzas de un futuro mejor.
Es su quinto préstamo con MFP, María es muy puntual en sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de su grupo, quienes son también muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más pescado para aumentar sus ventas y por ende generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 28, is a hard-working lady, who lives with her husband and small daughter, who unfortunately suffers from a heart defect. María works selling fish with her husband and they both work day by day to offer their daughter a good quality of life. However, sometimes their little daughter suffers relapses so they must frequently go to the doctor. Because of this, María usually can't stay in her post at the shop, leaving her husband (who appears in the photo) in charge. He knows how to manage the business very well in her absence. They both enjoy their work, which enables them to be independent and generate their own financial income. In the future, they hope to have a suitable place to increase their income to give their daughter hope for a better future.

This is María's fifth loan with MFP and she is very punctual with her payments, as are the other members of her group, who are also very responsible. With the money requested, she will buy mO. fish to increase their sales and thereby generate mO. income.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia R. is a widow and mother from the village of San Rafael, Aurora, Isabela. She is 60 years of age and gifted with seven children. She has been in her retail business of selling goods in her general store in their village for ten years. Being a widow mother is difficult, but Arsenia is still lucky because when her husband died, her children are already adults and had finished their studies.

Even though she is living by herself, she still wants to have other sources of income. Living without her partner is lonely, but she is still trying her best to move on and survive for future emergencies and her grandchildren. Looking for another source of income is not easy to do if there is not enough capital to build up. She wants to improve her business by borrowing additional capital amounting to 7,000 PHP from KIVA lenders to buy additional grocery items to sell to be able to gain more profit.

loans.use: additional capital to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jane G. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she  owns and operates a hog raising business.  Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. 

Mary Jane plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her  family's income.
--------------------------
About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.\n\n*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
el sr. Daniel G. tiene 39 años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de pan, el se levanta muy temprano a las 5 de la mañana para ir a la panaderia y comprar el pan y luego salir a venderlo en su bicicleta, todos los dias vende su producto, a veces no se da abasto y su producto se le termian rapido y deja de repartir a los otros clientes que tiene, necesita el credito para comprar mas pan y asi tener mayores ventas y ganancias, el es un señor muy amable.
se siente muy feliz ya que con este negocio puede mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel G. is 39 years old. His business is buying and selling bread. He gets up very early, at 5 in the morning, to go to the bakery and buy the bread, and then he goes out to sell it on his bicycle. He sells his product every day, but sometimes he cannot stock a large enough supply, so that he runs out of bread quickly and has to skip deliveries to some of his regular customers. He needs a loan to purchase more bread and thus achieve higher sales and a better income. He is a very likeable person who feels very happy since he is able to support his family with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bread

loans.name: Oka

texts.en:
Oka T. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Tufutafoe. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Oka owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Oka has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Oka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oka has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Oka is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Oka plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina A. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Lorina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lorina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lorina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lorina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lorina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi L., 35 years old, has been married for almost eleven years and has two children. His older child is nine years old while the younger is only two years old. He has a farm and a piggery.

Levi is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), as he needs additional capital for his businesses. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies, piglets and feed. He likes CEVI because not only do its loans have only a 2% interest rate, he was able to buy insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne B. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis trois ans et demi et a eu sept expériences avec le crédit. Son prêts lui permet de renforcer son activité, elle détient un atelier de couture où elle confectionne sur mesures. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille
texts.en:
Julienne B. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis trois ans et demi et a eu sept expériences avec le crédit. Son prêts lui permet de renforcer son activité, elle détient un atelier de couture où elle confectionne sur mesures. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge quotidienne de sa famille

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augmenter sa capacité d'investissemnt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita M. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Nonita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nonita owns & operates a business selling bed covers and blankets in the local community. Nonita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nonita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nonita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 51-year-old single woman living with her mother only. She has owned a mini-market in her town since 2008. She opened this small business and she works hard to earn income to help her old mother and take care of her.  Her shop is situated in a busy area, so she has been able to have a growing number of customers pass by her shop. 

Today, Mariam is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to fill her shop with additionA. merchandise like food products, drinks, cereals, etc., to meet the demand of her customers and gain new ones.

loans.use: fill her shop with additional merchandise

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan has a hospitable nature. She loves to serve people as the way she serves her family. This is her quality which everybody admires. 

She belongs to a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her husband name is K. A. who is a driver and drives a local bus. Hamidan has given birth to a single son who is in 3rd standard. 

She is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine so she starts sewing clothes to pay for the education expenses of her son. 

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Hajran baji wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her buffalo which she purchased for her milk selling business. Nawab wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: Rosa alba R. Vda. D. Z. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Candelaria, ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su padre quien trabaja como agricultor, así mismo junto a su hermano y dos hijos uno D. los cuales estudia y el otro trabaja como comerciante. Rosa es una personas muy trabajadora quien se ha esforzado mucho por salir adelante, ya que tuvo que criar a dos hijos ella sola sin la ayuda D. nadie más. DesD. hace muchos años atrás que ella trabaja elaborando puros, los cuales comercializa con sus diferentes clientes quienes hacen pedidos previos los cuales Rosa por si sola se encarga D. elaborar y repartir. Ella es una mujer muy humilD. quien se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y poder aportar a su hogar, ya sea alimento o lo necesario para poder mantener su hogar y D. esta manera salir adelante junto a sus hijos. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar tabaco por mayor y D. esta manera elaborar más cantidad D. puros.
texts.en:
Rosa Alba R. Vda. D. Z., 48 years of age, lives in the Candelaria municipality in Cuscatlán. She lives with her father, a farmer, her brother, and two children. One of her children is in school, and the other is working. Rosa is a very hard-working person, who has put forth great effort to get ahead as she had to single-handedly raise two children without receiving help from anyone. She has been making cigars, which she sells to her various customers, for many years. Customers place orders with her, and she alone makes and sells her product. She is a very humble woman, who works hard each and every day to get ahead and support the household, whether it’s to buy food or the necessary items for the home. In this manner, she would like to get ahead, along with her children. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy tobacco at wholesale and therefore be able to make a larger quantity of cigars.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tobacco.

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Nadsua

texts.en:
Nadsua is a married woman with two daughters and two sons, who all attend school. Her husband is a farmer and Nadsua operates a water kiosk and works as a tailor. With the Ksh. 40,000 loan, she wants to build another water line at the kiosk and buy a license so that she can get cheaper water. She also wants to purchase seeds for watermelons and fertilizer for her family's farm and build a kiosk for her tailoring business. The greatest challenge to her water business is that the jerrycans in which she transports water are often stolen. 

Nadsua currently rents her home and has no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food, and transportation. She hopes to expand her tailoring business and make school uniforms for the children in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To build water line and buy a water distribution license

loans.name: Kingsley

texts.en:
Kingsley is a retired soldier and also a community leader. He took into cocoa farming to be able to support his home. This also keeps him busy and energetic. His wife sells drinks. He has been in this business for long. He needs the loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more chemicals for weed control on his cocoa farm and also to clear his farm land for better yield.

He is blessed with 10 children. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more chemicals for weed control on his cocoa farm and also to clear his farm

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Siaka Konaté  est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de trois enfants qui vit dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, il adhéra au programme  de prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son troisième prêt individuel, tous les deux prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir 400  kilogrammes de grains d’arachide, 1000  kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre à la période où le cours sera plus  élevé.
Il s’approvisionne sur le marché de Fakola les jours de foire auprès des producteurs et effectue sa vente généralement à Bamako (capitale du Mali) aux revendeurs et à quelques consommateurs. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 FCFA soit 75.000FCFA  trimestriellement.
Il compte faire prospérer son commerce en faisant varier ses articles pour réaliser un chiffre d’affaire plus élevé dans les jours à venir. Le bénéfice prendra en charge les frais scolaire,  de santé,  de nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Siaka Konaté, 32, is married and the father of three children. He lives in a big traditional, extended family in the town of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. In order to better uplift himself out of poverty, he joined the individual loan program for stocking and selling cereals of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his third individual loan, both preceding loans having been reimbursed with no difficulty. With this loan he is intending to buy 400 kg of peanuts and 1000 kg of millet which he will warehouse so as to sell them when the price is higher. He buys his supplies in the market of Fakola, on weekly marketdays from the producers, and generally sells his goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) to retailers and some consumers. He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 F CFA or 75,000 F CFA per quarter. He hopes to make his business more prosperous by varying his inventory so as to have a greater turnover in future. The profit will cover school fees, health expenses, and food, with any remainder reinvested into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals to stockpile for resale

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: This group loan is made up of four people who live in Preaek Cheang Prum village in Kandal province. All the other members have been selected Mrs. Somaly N. as a group leader. She is 36 years old. Her position is a fruit seller at her local market where she earns some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Somaly N. is applying for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. Her husband, Mr. Phorng Meou, is a policeman earning a low salary to support his family. With these incomes, they support four children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the youngest one is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcos Andres

texts.es:
Marcos de 21 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, caminos pavimentados con lomas en disolución), el trabaja dando servicio de transporte, su papa le enseño a manejar desde pequeño. 

Marcos trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, para ayudar con los gastos familiares, en ocasiones trabaja con su hermano. Aunque es cansado manejar todo el día y tiene miedo que le roben por la delincuencia que hay, el continua trabajando para tener un mejor futuro.       

Quiere ayudar a sus padres construyendo mejor la casa donde viven por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y arena para rellenar las paredes que le faltan. En el futuro quiere estudiar para tener su profesión.
texts.en:
Marcos is 21 years old. He lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban region characterized by paved roads and eroding hillsides). His father taught him how to drive when he was very young and currently he works in transportation. Marcos works from 6:30 in the morning until 8:00 at night every day in order to help with the family expenses. Occasionally, he works with his brother. He is tired of driving all day. Also, as there is a high crime rate in the area, he is afraid of being robbed. Despite these challenges, however, he continues working in order to have a better future. He wants to help his parents improve the construction of their home. He is requesting the loan to buy cement and sand to fill the walls. In the future he wants to study so that he can have a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand

loans.name: Las Josefas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Josefas está conformado por Rosa Yolanda y Barbará Josefa. Rosa tiene 33 años y se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano para buscar los productos en el mercado y también realizar los diferentes productos que ofrecer como gallo pinto, tortas de carne, maduros, tajadas, enchiladas y refrescos. Por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida y por las noches es muy visitada por sus diferentes clientes. En el caso de Barbara se dedica a la venta de ropa, pues con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado obtener este medio de ingreso. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para sus diferentes productos que necesitan para su negocio. Juntas tienen los sueños de establecer un restaurante en donde las dos sean las dueñas.
texts.en:
The Josefas Solidarity Group consists of Rosa Yolanda and Barbará Josefa. Rosa is 33 years old and earns her living by preparing and selling food. Every day she wakes up early so that she can find the products she needs at the market. She offers different items such as beans and rice, meat pies, fried plantains, plantain chips, enchiladas, and soft drinks. Rosa feels very happy with this way of life and at night she is frequently visited by her different customers.

In Barbara’s case, she sells clothing with great effort as her means of income. The loan they are requesting will be used to buy different materials they need for their businesses. They dream of establishing a restaurant where they both are owners.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Richard Oino

texts.en:
Richard Oino K. is 37 years old. He is married to Rispah K. and a father of three school age children. He has a cereal store business that he has been running for the last 10years on a busy street in Narok Town. He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client. This will be his fourth loan, which he is planning to use to increase his stock of maize. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. Also this being the peak season for harvesting maize and wheat, he is hoping to buy more stock to sell later when the price and demand are high.

His future dream is that he will be able to build his own store and house. 

Richard also believes he is hard working and he only needs the resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To increase his stock of maize.

loans.name: Roberto Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto de 39 años de edad, es separado de su esposa,  tienen dos hijos el  vive en Alquiler,   en el Barrio el recreo  zona plan 3000, trabaja como chofer hace  ocho años.  El sr. Roberto  ahora es dueño de su propio microbús y de la línea 38, el trabajo mucho para poder comprarse ese micro, tanto que le costo su matrimonio, descuido a su esposa y a sus hijos y ahora se siente solo pero cuenta que saldrá adelante,  al  Sr. Roberto se le otorgo el crédito para la reparación de su microbús (reparación de caja, muelles y  cremalleras en general...). EL señor esta muy agradecido y sorprendido por la rapidez que se le otorgo el crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto, 39, is separated from his wife. They have two children. He is a renter in El Recreo neighborhood, Plan 3000 zone. He has worked as a bus driver for the last 8 years. He currently owns his microbus and works Route 38. He worked very hard to be able to buy that microbus so much so that it cost him his marriage. He neglected his wife and children and now feels alone but he states that he will continue to move forward. Roberto was granted a loan to repair the microbus (repair the gear box, gears and transmission). He is very grateful and surprised by the speed with which the loan was granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For microbus repair.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva J. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: battery repair/rehabilitation and pig fattening. She lives in Purok Demokrasya, Brgy Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her battery-repair and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Eva is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase raw materials for her battery repair/rehabilitation business. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Eva aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth María B. P., vive en el barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a su edad de 71 años de edad  y con dos hijos en las edades e 30 y 33 años, lo que mas le gusta en la vida es la costura; por eso creó un negocio de elaboración de prendas de vestir, desde hace mas de 25 años que le ayudó a  responder a  la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, porque después de la separación de su esposo esta era su mayor preocupación. Como en esa época no contaba con los recursos económicos apropiados, gradualmente elaboraba prendas de vestir y sus clientes traían la tela y los insumos y adornos, porque confeccionaba sobre medidas. Poco a poco con el fortalecimiento de este, llegó entonces a ofrecer el vestido ya elaborado, pero siempre teniendo en cuenta las medidas de cada uno. Así su negocio se convirtió en el medio de educar a sus hijos y brindarles todo lo que requiere una familia para sostenerse. 
Ruth María tiene algo más de 13 años  de ser cliente asidua de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que le ha fortalecido su capital de trabajo y de la mano de ella  ha logrado cambios positivos, con el tiempo ha crecido porque puede ofrecerle mayores opciones de ropa a sus clientes; su mayor desafío es la innovación constante para sostener a su clientela, quienes   la prefieren porque siempre presenta   estilos están modernos  y  adaptados a los gustos y percepciones de cada uno. En la actualidad solicita su credickiva, para   comprar materias primas y elaborar vestidos elegantes preparándose para la temporada de fin de año, porque siempre esta atenta a hacer de cada fin de año, un derroche de elegancia en estas fiestas familiares
texts.en:
Ruth María B. P. lives in the San Roque neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla.  She is 71 years old, and she has two children, ages 30 and 33.  What she likes to do most in life is sewing.  That is why she created a business making clothing.  

For over 25 years the business has helped her respond to the need of getting her family ahead.  After the separation from her husband, this was her biggest concern.  At that time she had no suitable economic resources.  

Gradually, she started making clothes.  Her customers brought her the fabric, supplies, and the trimmings because she made customized clothing.  Little by little her business became stronger, and she was able to sell ready made clothes.  However, she always keeps in mind the size of each one of her customers.  That is how her business became the means to educate her children and to support them with everything a family needs.

Ruth María has been a regular client of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for over 13 years.  This organization has strengthened her working capital, and through it she has managed to make positive changes.  In time, the business has grown, and she is able to offer her customers a greater variety of clothing.  Her biggest challenge is the constant innovation in order to maintain her customers.  

Her customers prefer her because she always has modern styles, which are adapted to what each one her customers like and their preferences.   

She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva to buy materials.  She will make elegant clothing in preparation for the end of the year season. At the end of every year she always tries to provide an abundance of elegance for these family celebrations.

loans.use: To buy materials to make elegant clothing in preparation for the end of the year season

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown daughter, Maryana. She is a private entrepreneur from Stryi, Western Ukraine. Galina sells groceries, i.e. cereal, noodles, spices, etc., in the local food marketplace. She offers a nice selection of groceries in her vending kiosk. Galina has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has 10,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Net profit is over 1,000 Grivnyas a month.

Galina is planning to invest a loan of 3,000 Grivnyas in the purchase of food merchandise for her kiosk. Many Ukrainians buy groceries in store for winter. The type of inventory Galina offers for sale in her kiosk is the most popular kind of products people usually buy, like canned food, noodles, sugar, flour and tea. Galina is hoping to sell up this batch of items and earn additional income as a result.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Yadira

texts.es:
Mercedes de 34 años, ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Avon ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo), ella vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Avon para tener ingresos ya que su esposo la abandono con sus tres hijos y también dales una mejor vida a sus hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. Vende los productos a sus conocidos y vecinos. 

Para incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, maquillaje, cremas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un local de los productos Avon.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 34, sells personal care products and cosmetics by catalog that are manufactured by Avon (a company that helps women entrepreneurs sell cosmetics at a low cost). She lives in Surburbio de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

Mercedes began selling Avon cosmetics to generate income because her husband abandoned her and their three children. She wants to give her children a good life and provide for their public school education. Mercedes sells makeup, perfumes, crémes, and deodorants by catalog at low cost. She sells these products to acquaintances and neighbors.

In order to increase her inventory, Mercedes will use this loan to buy perfumes, makeup, and crémes for her business. In the future, she hopes to finish the construction of her house and open a store where she can sell Avon products.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, makeup, and crémes

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
Bonifacia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 03 hijos. La señora realizó estudios de educación primaria.

Bonifacia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su   primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de puertas y ventanas de metal.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en materiales para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un taller más grande. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is a member of the "Azangarinas Valientes" communal bank located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  She is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children.  She has a primary school education.

Bonifacia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles (PEN).  She used the money to increase the capital of her business selling metal doors and windows.

Now she is asking for a new loan of 500 nuevos soles.  She will invest the money in materials for her business.

Her dream is to have a bigger shop.  What she most likes about her communal bank are the trainings and the chats.

loans.use: To buy materials for the manufacture of doors and windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty and natural products.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 31-year-old married man with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the last 10 years he has made a living by running a barber shop. He started with one station and has since expanded to three. Despite this expansion, he does not have enough stations and equipment to serve his customers. He would very much like to expand his business so that he can earn enough money to provide his children with an excellent education, and will use this loan to make that expansion possible.

loans.use: To expand a barber shop

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive por el sector de la Virgen de Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura, sus paisajes, su gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños y su gente es muy calida y amable.

Doña María tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 16, 13 años de edad, sus dos hijos  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es  Técnico Electrónico y brinda servicios técnicos de vehículos en su propio local, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. María trabaja en el local junto con su esposo, vende todo tipo de audio para vehículos (radios, parlantes), esta actividad la realiza hace 12 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es el cuarto crédito que realiza y fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte del banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería (radios). Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
María S. is a member of the “Nueva Vida” (New Life) communal bank.  She lives in the “La Virgen de Bronze” sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its architecture, its landscapes, and its food that captures the pallets of locals and guests.  Its residents are warm and friendly.

María is 45 years old.  She’s married and has two children, ages 16 and 13, who attend the local school.  Her husband works as an electronics technician and also does auto electrical repairs from his own shop.  They live in a rented home.

María works in the shop with her husband and sells all sorts of sound equipment for cars (radios, speakers).  She’s been doing this for 12 years and works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.

This will be her fourth loan.  She had been invited into the communal bank by her mother in law.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise (radios).  Her goal is to buy a house of their own.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Dufanyebahinzi No 2 Group

texts.fr:
Alexis N. est commerçante, et elle est un membre du groupe Dufanyebahinzi no 2.  Elle est née à Ruhuha, Rwanda, elle a 28 ans, mariée, et elle a 1 enfant de 4 ans.  Elle a fini 5 ans d’école primaire, est elle est client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des haricots, manioc, riz, et harachide.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer ses activités pour vendre ses articles dans les différents marchés.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, et pour sa famille, elle voudrait payer des frais scolaires et médicaux pour ses enfants.
*Thacienne N. était malade quand nous avons pris cette photo, alors son mari a pris son place dans la photo.
texts.en:
Alexis N., an entrepreneur, is a member of the Dufanyebahinzi No.2 group. She was born in Ruhuha, Rwanda. She is 28 years old, married, and has a 4-year old child. She has finished five classes of primary school. She has been a client of ACB sine 2010. She will use her loan to purchase beans, manioc (cassava), rice, and peanuts. Her business strategy is to increase her sales by offering her produce at different markets. She would like to become a wholesaler; as to her family, she would like to pay her [child’s] school fees and healthcare expenses.

*As Thacienne N. was ill at the time this photo was taken, her husband has replaced her in the photo.

loans.use: Purchasing beans, manioc, rice, peanuts

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Sarswati T., 49, is married and has three children, aged 23, 27 and 29. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, which she used to buy seeds and fertilizer for vegetable farming. In the future, Sarswati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal) and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates and join our lending team, BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang T. N. is 42 years old and has two children who are in high school. She is a very hard-working farmer who supports her family by growing rice, beans and corn on 3,600 square meters of land. She joined Seda in 2007 and has made effective use of several loans, all of which she paid back on time. She plans to use her portion of this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. 

Hoa T. P. is 44 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She makes a living by growing rice and raising chickens so she can sell their eggs. She will use her portion of this loan to buy chicken feed and build a structure where she can house her livestock.

Khuyen T. T. is 43 years old and has three children. She makes a living growing rice and vegetables and also runs a small shop. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her store.

Kim T. N. is 41 years old and makes a living running a shop where she sells fresh fruit. She will use her portion of this loan to improve her shop.   

Hanh T. N. is 47 years old and makes a living selling scrap metal. She will use her portion of this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand five small businesses

loans.name: Virginia Hermelinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Virginia, ella tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una linda niña de tres años. Su esposo es trabajador eventual. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cinco ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos papeleos.

Tiene en sus casa una pequeña panadería en la cual trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él está desocupado pero cuando él está trabajando  hace todo ella sola, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00 y en las noches desde las 20h00hasta las 22h00 ya que a esta hora deja todo listo para la mañana siguiente hornear el pan. Lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y esto lo aprendió de su mamá.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar harina, sal, manteca y otros ingredientes para elaborar el pan. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que este crezca.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic most of whose residents raise animals and are farmers because it’s an area with much vegetation.

We met Virginia here.  She’s 29 years old, married and has a lovely, 3 year old, daughter.  Her husband is a temporary worker.  She’s been in the communal bank for five cycles and likes it because the loans are quick without so much paperwork.

She has a small bakery at home that she runs with help from her husband when he’s unoccupied but when he’s working she does all the work by herself.  She works every day from 5am until 3pm and at night from 8pm until 10pm which is when she leaves everything ready for the following day’s bread baking.  She’s been in this occupation for several years; she learned it from her mother.

She will use the loan to buy flour, salt, lard and other bread baking ingredients.  Her goal is to stay in business and that it grows.

loans.use: To buy flour, salt, lard, eggs and other baking ingredients.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
As you can see in the picture, Ekua S. sells yams. She does this at the market of Jukwa which is a community near Abura close to Cape Coast. Yams can be prepared in lots of different ways and are very common in Ghana. Ekua is divorced and takes care of her four children by herself. To do this she uses the income from her business. 

Sometimes she struggles and wishes to have a more solid financial foundation. That’s why she would be very happy to boost her business with the help of a loan to increase her profit. In order to achieve this goal she is planning to buy more yams and thus sell more. She hopes to be able to take good care of her children with the newly earned profit.

loans.use: to buy more yams to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel S. A. de 34 años de edad habita en casa propia con sus dos pequeños hijos  uno de los cuales se encuentra estudiando. Isabel tiene una tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, papel, detergente, golosinas, productos de belleza, verduras, bebidas. Además de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa. En el Municipio de Sonsonate del Departamento de Sonsonate. Es una mujer increíble con muchos sueños y metas. Ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para mantener su tiendita y quiere seguir haciéndolo para que un día pueda pasar a manos de sus hijos y les pueda seguir dando frutos como hasta ahora a sido con ella. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este préstamo a INTEGRAL ya que es la única forma de poder abastecer su negocio con variedad de productos de primera necesidad tales como: cereales, detergentes, golosinas, verduras, accesorios de belleza, condimentos etc.  Para que su negocio luzca más atractivo y los clientes sigan prefiriéndola. De esta manera poder aspirar a una mejor vida para sus hijos.
texts.en: Isabel S. A. is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 small children, one of whom is in school.  Isabel has a store in her house where she offers everyday consumer goods such as: rice, sugar, toilet paper, detergent, candy, beauty products, vegetables and drinks.  In addition to this she also has a business selling clothing in the municipality of Sonsonate in the Sonsonate department.  She is an extraordinary woman who has a lot of dreams and goals.  She has worked for a long time to keep her little store running, and she wants to continue doing this work so that some day she can pass the business on to her children and it can continue to provide for them, as it has done for her.  This has motivated her to request this loan from INTEGRAL, since this is the only way that she will be able to supply her business with a variety of consumer products such as: cereals, detergents, sweets, vegetables, beauty products, condiments, etc.  This will make her business will look more appealing so that the customers will choose to shop there.  In this way, she hopes to be able to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy cereals, detergents, sweets, vegetables, beauty products, and condiments

loans.name: 10 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: Hương Lê Thị T. (52) owns and operates a retail clothing business. Her main source of income comes from providing general clothing services to local community members. She is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of T. Hoá. Hương is married and has two school-aged children.She has been engaged in the business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2010, Hương joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Hương is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10 Đông Vệ (08.01.10 Đông Vệ). About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị T. Hà (53) is a 35 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. 2. P. Thị Tứ (54) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. 3. N. Thị Xuân (55) is a 54 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. 4. T. Thị Hiền (56) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business. About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== Hương Lê Thị T. (52) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoá. Hương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10 Đông Vệ (08.01.10 Đông Vệ). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 3,500,000 VND. Vào 2010, Hương đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị T. Hà (53) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 2. P. Thị Tứ (54) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 3. N. Thị Xuân (55) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 4. T. Thị Hiền (56) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Z. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 47 years old. Mary Jane is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Mary Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Yeshenia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unión Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por la calidez de su gente y por su empuje para salir adelante.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yeshenia, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 17, 16 y 9 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y bisutería. Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo en una distribuidora. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Este crédito lo quiere utilizar para poner una tienda de comestibles  en la casa, nos cuenta que ha arreglado su local y que solo le falta comprar los productos para echar en marcha su negocio.
	
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos necesarios para surtir su negocio. Está hace ocho ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Unión Y Desarrollo" (Unity and Development) meets every two weeks in the Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for the warmth of its people and its push to progress.

In this place, we meet Señora Yeshenia.  She is 38 years old, married and with her husband has three children who are 17, 16 and 9 years old.  The older ones go to high school, and the youngest to elementary school.  Her husband has a cabinetmaking workshop.

Señora Yeshenia is a homemaker who, in order to have her own resources, makes a living selling cosmetics and costume jewelry.  She works three days a week.  She sells her products on credit and collects the payments weekly.  She purchases her products from a distributor in downtown Portoviejo.  She has been earning a living in this business for five years, and it is going very well.  This loan is intended for opening a grocery shop in her home.  Señora Yeshenia tells us that she has fixed-up her shop and only needs to purchase the products to open for business.
	
This loan is for the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other products that she needs to stock up her store.  Señora Yeshenia has been with the communal bank for 8 cycles.  She is the bank treasurer.  She likes the bank because the payments are easy to make.
 
Señora Yeshenia's dream is to have her own home, since the one she lives in is a rental.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents and other products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, single and lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Mohamad is a blacksmith; in 2010 he opened his own workshop, making doors and windows. He has a long experience and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

 He is requesting a $2000 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 41 years old, married, and has three children. They live in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del norte. To earn a living, Jenelyn has a business selling tobacco to her customers in different areas in town. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month. Jenelyn is requesting loan to purchase fertilizers.

Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to have her own motorcycle for the delivery of her tobacco.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is a 23 year old mother blessed with 2 children. Shella is a farmer working in the Philippines who grows root crops. She has been doing it for almost 5 years and she earns PHP 3,000 per month. 

Shella is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  

In the future, Shella hopes to improve their source of income in order to give her children a better future and  to improve their standard of living. She was thankful when she found out Kiva lenders would assist them to improve their source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 58 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rogelia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 24,500 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods and other groceries in her sari-sari store.

Rogelia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, noodles, spices, oil, etc. 

In the future, Rogelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Sabina

texts.es: La Sra. Yolanda es madre soltera, tiene una sola hija que se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Yolanda se dedica a la venta de tamales, que los ofrece los fines de semana  teniendo clientes y conocidos por la zona donde vive. Ya lleva 3 años en este negocio, su principal desafío que enfrenta la Sra. Yolanda es soportar el frio todas las madrugadas de los fines de semana. Su sueño es tener un hogar digno donde vivir y que su única hija sea profesional. La Sra. Yolanda va a invertir el crédito en el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado a su persona.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a single mother.  She has just one daughter who is currently studying at university.  Yolanda sells tamales on weekends to customers and acquaintances around where she lives.  She’s been in business three years.  The main challenge Yolanda faces is withstanding the cold at dawn on weekends. 

 Her dream is to have a proper home in which to live and that her daughter becomes a professional.  Yolanda wants to invest the loan in home improvements.  She is very grateful for the loan granted her.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOBENKOUN II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, DJENEBOU, la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000F CFA en en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the KOBENKOUN II group are married women who have an average age of 35 and on average six children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, DJENEBOU, in the middle of the standing row, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

The crops are sold at the village market, at the Banco market, and at the N’Golobougou market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Djenebou expects to make an average profit of 65,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is 29 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for four years. He has been able to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Dennis dreams of expanding his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 100,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and soap.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 33 years old, married to Deborah, and they have six school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.

In future, Joseph hopes to become one of the leading supplier of milk in Ndunyu Njeru town and its environs.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 28 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for one year. 

Mathew was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Mathew hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine has two children and a husband. Her children are five months old and two years old. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. She sells vegetables in the markets. She has been doing this for the last three years. With this business she has been able to buy land and a motorcycle to use for business.  Vestine would like a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She will use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en:
Star, who is in her late 30s, is a widow with three children, two of whom go to school.  She has been a food vendor since 2005. She works from 2 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying out of stock items for her food business. Her dream is to one day be able to own a grocery.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Pera", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy out of stock items for her food business.

loans.name: Alberto Miguel

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 24 años,  vive con su madre, es soltero, se dedica a la venta ambulante de colchas, hamacas, y demás en la zona metropolitana, específicamente en la zona de la ciudad de Luque y alrededores. Al terminar su ciclo básico de la enseñanza escolar se dedicó a la profesión ya que su mamá es madre soltera, y de esta forma podrá ayudarla con los gastos de la casa. El es muy sacrificado ya que realiza las ventas casa por casa recorriendo varios kilómetros en su moto.
Comenta que aprendió la profesión de su tío ya que antes salía con él y lo inculcó para que se dedique de lleno en la venta para que así pueda crecer como persona y como profesional, y de esa manera poder ayudar a su madre quien prácticamente ha quedado a su cargo y juntos tratan de sobresalir económicamente día tras día.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de colchas, hamacas y demás con lo cual podrá abastecer su stock y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alberto, 24, lives with his mother and is single.  He is a street vendor selling bedspreads and hammocks in the metropolitan area, specifically in the city of Luque and nearby areas.  When he finished his elementary education he began working with his mother who is single.  This way he could help cover household expenses.  He is very self-sacrificing and sells door to door traveling several kilometers on his motorcycle.

He says he learned the trade from his uncle who taught him how to dedicate his time to selling so he could grow into a professional and help his mother, who practically depends on him for getting ahead economically on a daily basis.

He is requesting a loan to buy bedspreads, hammocks and other items to add to his stock so he can meet customers'  requirements.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads and hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Raising crops is the primary source of income at Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. Noel and his family are engaged in this kind of work. He plants and harvests rice and future merchandise for the local traders in the village. Noel patiently ensures a good crop during planting season up to harvesting. He usually earns a yield twice a year (April and November) for about PHP 9,000. 

Noel is now 28 years old, married to Jennifer and has two children. He wants to improve his crop production for the education of his children so he needs fertilizers and herbicides to be used in rice farming. As of now, Noel has insufficient fund so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy these inputs.

In the future, Noel would like to improve his farming practices and increase his rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Daysi Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra. Daisy Esperanza tiene 36 años de edad, junto a su esposo han procreado 3 hijos y se dedican al cultivo de café desde hace de 3 años, Daisy tiene su propia finca, 2 manzanas de café cosechero, a la vez su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos lo que le genera ingresos suficientes para hacerle frente a los gastos del hogar.
  
Daisy utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, su casa de habitacion se encuentra montaña adentro y se dificulta contar con energía eléctrica,  servicio muy importante para el desarrollo de su familia, con el sistema solar podrán tener energía eléctrica limpia y renovable,  doña Daisy piensa seguir trabajando con prisma para mejorar su finca y optimizar una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Daisy Esperanza, 36, and her husband have had three children; they have been growing coffee for three years.  Daily has her own farm with two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of coffee plants.  Her husband also farms basic grains that produce income enough to cover household expenses.

Daisy will use the loan to buy a solar energy panel.  Their house is located deep in the mountains and getting electricity is difficult, a utility that’s very necessary for her family’s development.  With a solar generating system they would have clean, renewable energy.  Daisy plans to continue working with Prisma to improve her farm and optimize production.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Odilia, ella hace el comentario que desD. pequeña se ha dedicado a la agricultura y que eso le ha dado la vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos y su satisfacción mas granD. es que ya solo tiene dos para graduarse a causa D. su producto, para entregar un buen producto a sus clientes esta asociada con cooperativa 4 pinos que es donD. ella y sus hijos reciben capacitación para tener un buen control en la siembra D. ejote y arveja, es su segundo crédito en kiva y ha demostrado mucha puntualidad y hoy necesita el crédito para invertir en su siembra ya que nececita comprar abono para su siebra y nos comenta que le gusto el crédito ya que las cuotas le bajaron a cada mes, agradese a kiva por aberle dado la oportunidad D. un credito ya que le a sido D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Odilia comments that from an early age she has worked in farming and this has given her the means to raise her children; her greatest satisfaction is that through her produce she only has 2 children left to graduate. To deliver a good product to her clients, she is a member of the 4 Pinos cooperative which is where she and her children have received training to ensure good control in the planting of peas and green beans. This is her second loan with Kiva and she has shown herself to be very punctual . She now needs the loan to invest in her crop as she needs to buy manure and tells us that she liked the loan as the amount owed fell every month. She is grateful to Kiva for having given her the opportunity of receiving a loan as it has been a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy manure for farming.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem is 46 years old and married with five children. Presently she lives with them and her husband in Kompong Speu province. She and her spouse have been involved in farming for almost 19 years. Together, they typically earn around $2.00 per day.

Yoem is currently asking for a microloan of $500 to buy a motorcycle so her family can have the best possible transportation service. She hopes that lenders will not reject her first loan request.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so her family has the best possible transportation service.

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en:
Chhin is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school. Originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is common, she has been farming on her rice field as a primary business for eight years and she has supplemented her income by planting cassava for two years. She now earns more than five U.S. dollars per day from her current business. 

This is her first group loan with VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to grow more cassavas so as to earn more income and make a better living.  She wants to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza nació en la ciudad de Abancay del departamento de Apurímac pero actualmente vive en la ciudad Yucay.( El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú). 

Lorenza tiene 45 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella tiene dos actividad económicas principales que realiza durante todo el año. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía y a la venta de productos de belleza de las marcas de Esika y Unique. Ella tambien elabora diferentes tipos de tejidos como mantas, chompas, pasadizos, chullos, frazadas y otras cosas más. Ella vende sus tejidos de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de uno de los hoteles más lujosos de la ciudad de Yucay. 

En esta oportunidad Lorenza requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como lana para seguir elaborando tejidos. Lorenza con las ganancias del negocio puede educar y alimentar a sus hijos por eso es muy importante el préstamo.  

Lorenza es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en la ciudad de Yucay.
texts.en:
Lorenza was born in the city of Abancay but currently lives in the city of Yucay. (The peruvian district of Yucay is one of the seven districts in the province of Urubamba, located in the Department and Region of Cusco.) Lorenza, age 45, has 5 children as a result of her happy marriage. She has two main areas of work all year round. She sells handicrafts and beauty products from the "Esika" and "Unique" brands. She also makes a variety of woven items, including ponchos, sweaters, hats, table runners, and blankets. She sells her work on foot at the door of one of the most luxurious hotels in the city of Yucay.

Lorenza needs a loan to buy more materials, such as wool for weaving. With the money she makes from her work, Lorenza is able to educate and feed her children, so the loan is very important to her. She is a member of the “Virgen Natividad” Communal Bank, a group formed of 15 members. some of the members live in the city of Huayllabamba and others in the city of Yucay.

loans.use: To buy more materials, such as wool

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es: Maria Gertrudis tiene 58 años de edad, su negocio que ella tiene es la venta de ropa usada  en el cual ya tiene años de experiencia y sus clientes la buscan por la calidad de ropa que tiene y el servicio que ella les brinda. Este negocio lo inicia como una alternativa de trabajo ya que ella necesitaba apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Maria Gertrudis está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en el negocio en la compra de pacas para aumentar su inventario y ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad ropa.
texts.en: María Gertrudis, 58, sells used clothes; she has years’ experience and her customers seek her out because of the quality of the clothes she has and the service she provides.  This business started as a work alternative since she needed to help her husband with household expenses.  María Gertrudis is requesting a loan to invest in the business buying bundles of clothes to increase inventory and have a variety of clothes available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Tungalagtuya

texts.en:
Tungalagtuya is 30 year old widowed woman who lives with her 3 daughters in the central part of the country. After the death of her husband, she and her 3 daughters were left without a family provider. She moved to the center of the country to find work a year ago. She has been sewing and making traditional clothes in a rented room. Due to the coming traditional festival, she needs to purchase materials like silk and cotton for her work to sell them before the holiday. 

Tungalagtuya is an intelligent and a hardworking woman and says that 'I would like to receive this loan to earn more during the holidays and it's for our lives, my 3 daughters school fees and their clothes and other needs.' She is requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase material to sew Deel,  traditional Mongolian clothing.

loans.use: To purchase material to sew Deel, traditional Mongolian clothing.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la victoria, donde todas y cada una esta haciendo la encuesta de la eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de las capacitaciones podrán ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una.
Integra este grupo la Sra. Alicia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que en muchos de los indicadores de la encuesta esta en nivel rojo. Entre el trabajo que ella hace comenta que se dedica a la venta de bordados  que ella misma hace, y que por medio de ese trabajo está luchando por un futuro mejor para su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales como agujas, hilos,  agujas de croché y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y más venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Victoria”. All of the members are taking the poverty elimination survey. As a result of their training, the members have been able to improve their living conditions.

Sra. Alicia is a member of this group. Her latest survey indicated that she was at a stage one poverty level, which means that she had several indicators that were at the red level. Regarding her work, Alicia says that she sells embroideries that she produces herself. Through this line of work, she is striving to provide a better future for her family.

Sra. Alicia is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as needles, thread, crochet needles, and other items. This will allow her to produce and sell more, which will help to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, crochet needles, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of Merchandise

loans.name: Elchin
