texts.en: Elchin is an IDP from occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. In 1996 he started his private business in Baku. In 1999-2006 he borrowed five loans totalling $5800. Now he would like to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Sose

texts.en: Sose is applying for her first loan.  Neither she nor her husband have a job, and they rely on their small taro plantation for survival.  Sose realizes that they need to invest in the plantation and increase the output of the plantation if they are going to be able to support their children.  They live in a very small village, and their four boys attend the local village school, and it is the income from their taro crop that is paying for their school fees.  Sose is a firm believer in hard work, and she thinks with a loan they can purchase some basic tools and fertilizer to do some more planting and grow their crop.  Any extra income they can bring in would have a direct and noticeable impact on the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Expand taro plantation

loans.name: Luz Areli

texts.en: My business is making and packaging tortillas, and I have been doing so for 3 1/2 years.  I sell in my community and I support my family with the income I earn. Currently I need capital to be able to add more supplies to my business.

loans.use: Purchase corn and packaging for tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing that is both varied and seasonal

loans.name: Gul

texts.en: I am Gul Z. and I moved to Lahore, second largest city of Pakistan, from a small mountainous town after my marriage. I live in a little rented house with my husband and five children. I understand the importance of education and therefore I have enrolled all of my children in school except the youngest two who are too small to go to school. I make decorative tassels for jewelry whereas my husband runs an electric appliances shop. Together we are able to make $200 a month. My husband does not have a complete range of appliances at his shop and so many of his customers' requests are turned down. We want to fulfill our customers' needs and that takes more product variety. This will cost us US$ 550. Expanding our business this way will leave us with sizeable profits which we will save to buy a house of our own.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Koim

texts.en: Mrs. Koim V. L., age 47, runs a stand from her home selling vegetables, earning around $2 each day. Her husband works as a carpenter, making on average around $2.50 each day. They have four children. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi to earn additional income for his family when he is not working at the carpentry shop.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to run a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Felismina Aida

texts.pt:
Felismina Aida C. is married with two children. She lives in Matola. She sells fish and shrimp as a street vendor. She is joining the program and would like to borrow 6000 meticais to pay back in four months. With these funds, she will increase the amount of products.

Translated by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Felismina Aida C., potadora do BI nº100333510N, Vive maritalmente , tem 2 filhos vive na cidade da Matola, vende peixe camarão e vendedora ambulante, esta a entrar no programa vai tomar o valor de 6000 mt para pagar em 4 meses com o valor voi aumentar os produtos.

loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod Abdurahmanov is 31 years old, has finished college with a degree in agronomy. He is married and has 2 children. For the last year Mr. Abdurahmanov made his living by raising and selling cattle. He buys calves and sells them after fattening every 40-45 days. He uses the money he makes from the sales to purchase additional calves and will use the surplus for paying back his loan and feeding his family. The current loan will allow Dilshod to have the necessary money for this sort of work, so that he can have a source of income. Dilshod is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Абдурахмонов Дильшод, возраст – 31 год, образование – высшее, по специальности агроном, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Клиент занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 1 года. Он приобретает и продаёт скот после откорма через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать молодой скот, а полученную прибыль испоьзовать на погашение кредита и содержание своей семьи. Данный кредит даст возможность Дильшоду иметь необходимый капитал для этого вида деятельности, для того чтобы он имел источник дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: raising and sale of cattle

loans.name: José Justo

texts.es:
Jose is 40 years old and is a single father to his two children ages 5 and 7. He has been responsible for their care and education since his wife abandoned him and left the children in his care. He has always worked hard to improve their quality of life. They live in a very poor neighborhood called Luareles Sur, a rural area without basic services.

The living conditions of this family are very humble, with dirt floors, one main room, a roof damaged by the constant rain and sun. Jose works as a security guard and has not been able to earn enough to repair his house. With this loan, he will make the repairs on his house so that his children can develop and grow up in a dignified way. The most urgent requirement is for materials to patch the cracked walls, which have lifted up in the strong winds and rains of recent months.

José es un padre de familia soltero, de 40 años de edad, a su cargo están sus 2 hijos 5 y 7 años, a los cuales cuida, alimenta, educa en base a las posibilidades económicas con las que cuenta el señor, su esposa lo abandonó dejándoles a los niños a su cargo, siempre ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia, habita con sus pequeños hijos en el asentamiento Laureles Sur, un barrio muy pobre, rural, en donde no cuentan con todos los servicios básicos. La vivienda de esta familia es muy humilde, no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, el piso es de tierra, no existe división en la casa, el techo se encuentra dañado debido a las constantes lluvias del invierno y el sol, todo esto debido a la falta de mantenimiento inmediato de su vivienda, Trabaja como guarda de seguridad y no ha podido realizarle mejoras a su vivienda. El préstamo de este señor es para acondicionar su vivienda en donde sus hijos se puedan desarrollar dignamente, la necesidad mayor en estos momentos es la de cambiar el zinc de la vivienda, ya que se encuentra con sarro, rajado y ciertas partes están levantadas por los fuertes vientos y lluvias que azotaron en meses pasados.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ZINC LAMINATE, NAILS AND ANTICORROSIVE PAINT TO REPAIR HIS SMALL HOME.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.es:
Hilda and Delia have belonged to the Ccatarisun Communal Bank which means “lift us” in Quechua, for 2 years. Hilda lives with her partner, she is 24 years old and has 3 children. Hilda sells spare parts for cars in a rented place, an activity she has done for 6 months. On the other hand, Delia is single and is 22, Delia works with her brother, they have a printer and Internet booths, located on a central street of the city of Ayacucho. Hilda and Delia need loans of 1000 soles, 750 soles, money that they will invest in the purchase of spare parts for cars, and memory for the computers. The dreams of Hilda and Delia are to improve their business, that their children study, and to have another printer.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda y Delia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2 años .

Hilda es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Hilda venD. repuestos para motos en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses.

Por otro lado Delia es soltera y tiene 22 años, delia junto a su hermano tienen una imprenta y cabinas D. Internet, ubicados en una calle céntrica D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Hilda y Delia necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. repuestos para motos, memorias para las computadoras.

Los sueños D. Hilda y Delia son surtir su negocio, que sus hijos estudien, tener otra imprenta.

loans.use: Hilda and Delia need loans of 100 soles, 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for cars and memory for computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena C. is 53 years old. She is married with three boys and two girls who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of their children in school.

She operates a clothing shop in the community market. She sells various kinds of textile cloths with both traditional and industrial designs as well as linen materials. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of cloth and linen materials to increase her stock so she can earn more income for her business and family.

She is a member of the group called Faith Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of men's and women's textiels and linen materials.

loans.name: Byron

texts.es:
Byron is a single 24-year old who lives in the Hialeah IV neighborhood in Managua. Byron dedicates himself to welding and is also a bricklayer, work that he has carried out for two years. His profession started when he was studying bricklaying, but thanks to the effort he put into his work he learned the welding trade.

His plan is to acquire enough experience to start working on his own. While he is single and still without the responsibility of a family, he wants to start making improvements to his house. This is the reason he is asking for a loan; he would like to purchase building materials and add a bedroom to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Byron es un joven de 24 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa de Managua y es soltero. Byron se dedica a la soldadura y tambien es albañil, desde hace dos años ha realizado estas profesiones, su profesión la inició como ayudante de albañil, pero gracias al empeño que puso en su trabajo aprendió el oficio de soldador. Sus planes son poder adquirir la suficiente experiencia para poder realizar su trabajo de forma independiente. Ahora que está soltero y sin responsabilidades desea empezar a mejorar la construcción de su casa, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer una habitación en su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase building materials to install a bedroom in his house.

loans.name: Fotima.

texts.ru:
Fotima Shokrirova lives in the are Rudaki. She is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a high school education. To provide for her family she needs to work a lot. She owns a store, where she trades food products. She wants to increase commodity circulation, and wants to bring in new goods for the start of the school season. She wants to bring in writing goods. To be able to do this she plans to receive a loan that she will repay in 12 months. This will help her earn an income in the trade season and allow her to spend the money on her children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Шокирова Фотима живет в районе Рудаки. Возраст 36 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей.Образование среднее. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью ей приходится много работать . Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Хочет увеличить товарооборот.Привезти новый товар к школьному сезону. Хочет привезти канцелярские товары. Для этого она планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей заработать в сезон торговли , и заработанные деньги использовать для детей.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Karim's Group

texts.en:
Karim baji lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. Karim baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is a mason. Her husband, A. H., has worked in the fruit business for the last 10 years and earns $26 per month. Karim baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more paints for her paint shop. Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy tractor. Razia baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to re-sell. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more fruit inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro.

Rosa es viuda, tiene 65 años y 6 hijos de los cuales 1 hijo que ya tiene familia vive con ella, Rosa vende comida en un puesto del mercado Magdalena, en donde vende carne variada, el cual es adquirido en el camal de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades compra los animales en la feria de San Juan y luego lo beneficia en el camal, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y caprino. Los sueños de Rosa son mejorar su negocio, su hijo culmine sus estudios y sea un profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank 'Futuro' (Future).

Rosa is a widow, she is 65 years old and has 6 kids of whom one who has a family lives with her. Rosa sells food in a stall in the Magdalena market. She sells various meats which she buys in the slaughterhouse in Ayacucho, and at some opportunities she buys animals in the San Juan market before taking them to the slaughterhouse. She does this every week day from 7am - 1pm.

Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles; money that she will invest in buying cattle and goats. Rosa's dream is to improve her business, for her son to finish his studies and be a successful professional.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1500; money that will be invested in buying cattle and goats/Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y caprino.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 24 and lives in Beirut. She owns a small beauty salon in her neighborhood and she wants to improve it by repainting her walls and installing new mirrors for her clients. She has asked for loan of $1000 for this purpose. This will be Therese's first loan.

loans.use: to redecorate Therese's beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Salome J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Salome M. from Kyela. She is single but has two children ages 3 and 6. Salome has been running a vitenge (a sarong-like garment for women) and crops business since 2006. She purchases vitenge and cacao in wholesale and sells them.

She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Salome currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more vitenge and cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Salome thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more vitenge and cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.en:
Fortunita is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their four children. 

Fortunita sells different brands of catalogue cosmetics, like Avon and Esika. She sells her products to friends and family members, and also sells them on credit. Fortunita and her husband also own a motorcycle taxi, which they use to transport passengers around the city of Ayacucho.  Fortunita needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi.  

Fortunita’s dreams are to join a formal taxi drivers' association and to buy a car. 



Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Fortunita es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Fortunita es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita vende cosméticos por catálogos de diferentes lineas como Avon, Esika, sus productos los ofrece a sus amigos, familiares y los vende al crédito. Además Fortunita junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el que realiza transporte en la ciudad de Ayacucho. 
Fortunita necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos para la mototaxi. 
Los sueños de Fortunita son integrar su mototaxi en una asociación formal y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Replacement parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn N. is a pig breeder in Sro Mor village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old and the mother of five children: one is employed in a garment factory, three others are farmers, and the youngest one attends the local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Pak Vet, is a construction worker. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets for breeding and more pig food.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, 52 years old and married to Efrenand, has four children. Her husband is working as a farmer like most of the residents of their village, since farming is the major source of livelihood there. Their children are: Analyn - 29 years old, a graduate of a computer secretarial course; Alberto - 26 years old, working as a machine operator in Manila; Noel - 25 years old, a college graduate; and Joel - 23 years old. Her children are her treasure in life, however, she feels sad because she was not able to provide all of them with a better education.

Hog-raising is her choice of business. This has been her way of helping her husband provide their financial needs. She dreams of becoming successful in the business. This has motivated her to request a loan of PHP 5,000 that she will use to purchase piglets, feed, and medicines for her hogs. She believes that the improvement of her business also depends on hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà  27  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm2007. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn , trồng lúa, rau tại nhà. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi, trồng trọt chị còn đi làm thuê cho cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh dịch vụ ăn uống tại địa phương để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng, cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hoà, 27 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, she raises pigs and grows rice and vegetables at her home. Outside the time she spends on her animals and farming, she works part-time as a waitress in a local restaurant in order to earn some extra income for her family. With an income of 2,500,000 VND (144 USD) per month, the standard of living of her family is now steadily improving. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to buy more pigs and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Roula Group

texts.en:
The group name is Roula; it is made up of three ladies who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. LayA. is a 27-year-old woman who has three children. LayA. has been working in chocolate design for five years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase chocolate and designs. This is the first time that LayA. has requested a loan.
LayA. is speciA. in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty working while taking care of her children. LayA. decided on doing her business because she wanted to work and supplement her family’s income, and she has experience in her work. In the future, she plans on improving her work. Doha is a 33-year-old woman. She has been working in chocolate design and she also sells flowers. Doha requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her businesses. This is the first time that Doha has requested a loan.
Doha is speciA. in her work because she likes what she does and she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capitA.. Doha decided on doing her business because she has experience. In the future, she plans on expanding and improving her businesses. Roula is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been selling beauty products. Roula requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Roula has requested a loan. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Roula first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capitA.. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to have independent work. In the future, Roula plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Yawo Noulagbesu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside avec sa femme et ses 02 enfants dans le quartier d’Avenou qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille il a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son stock actuel de marchandises est épuisé et pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 05 cartons de couscous, 02 cartons de lait en poudre, 05cartons de lait liquide, 05 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, des cartes de recharges
texts.en:
This gentleman resides with his wife and his two children in Avenou, a district in the city of Lomé. To provide for his family he started doing commerce in grocery items. His current stock of merchandise is exhausted, and to resupply himself, he’s requesting his first WAGES loan to buy: five boxes of couscous, two boxes of powdered milk, five boxes of liquid milk, five boxes of pasta, and some mobile phone cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J., 28, sells maize flour, bread and requests a loan to open a shop. She married a peasant who owns a small farm that grows green vegetables. Susan has two children who attend primary school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a plot for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Иброгимов Баходур более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Возраст 27 лет. Проживает в районе Явана. Баходур покупает крупно рогатый скот откармливает и перепродает. Этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить дойную корову. И в дальнейшем продавать молоко.
texts.en:
Bahodur I. has practiced animal husbandry for over five years. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the Yavan district. Bahodur buys cattle to fatten then resell. The business provides his sole source of income. He is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow so that he will be able to sell milk in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Mr. Roque J. is 40 years old and is married to Mrs. Olinda, who is 28 years old. The couple has two children who are in school. They live in their own home in the city of Villa Florida.

Roque is the owner of a small grocery store and a butcher shop that is connected to the store. In this store he sells general items, as well as clothing (winter clothing and undergarments). This business has been running for over six years and is attended to by his wife and himself.

When Roque started his business he started with a very small investment and with very little merchandise in his grocery store. As time passed, his business grew substantially and he formed a stable clientele base. This business helps him pay off any debts he has.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Mamoutou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mamoutou   K. est âgé de 38 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants, son épouse et d’autres ménages chez son oncle dans une famille traditionnelle élargie dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (4ème  région administrative de la république  du Mali). 
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons religieuses, il commença très tôt le commerce auprès de son grand frère qui vendait des pièces détachées au grand marché de la ville de Ségou. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage  auprès de ce dernier, il acquiert une solide expérience dans  le commerce de pièces pour moto. C’est ainsi qu’il  décida d’évoluer seul  dans ce créneau  il y a de cela  8 ans au marché  du quartier Médine de Ségou. Sa boutique située en plein centre du marché, est facile d’accès. Mamoutou est d’un commerce très agréable et sollicité de beaucoup de réparateurs et propriétaires de moto.  
Dans le but satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il  fait recours à l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Il  compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1 carton de cylindres, 30 pneus et 2 cartons de bougies pour moto sur place à Ségou auprès des grossistes. Mamoutou K. vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui  sera réinjecté dans ses activités et  aider la famille élargie dans la prise en charge des dépenses (nourriture, habillements, santé, éducation).
Son ambition est d’avoir un chez soi (une maison à usage d’habitation)
texts.en:
Mr Mamoutou K. is 38 years old, and lives with his two children and his wife, together with other households, at his uncle's, in an extended traditional family in the Médine neighborhood in the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having never attended school for religious reasons, he started working early on with his older brother, who used to sell spare parts at the grand market in Ségou. After several years of learning with him, he acquired a strong experience as a motorcycle spare parts reseller. This is why, eight years ago, he decided to go his separate way in this field in the Médine neighborhood in Ségou. His store is located at the market center, and is easy to get to. Mamoutou is kind, and many motorcycle repairmen and owners work with him.

In order to meet the demand of his steeply increasing clientele, he's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. He intends to use it to buy 1 box of cylinders, 30 tires, and 2 boxes of motorcycle spark plugs from wholesalers in Ségou. Mamoutou K. retails for cash and on one-month credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

With this loan, he hopes to turn a monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 215), that will in part be reinvested in his business, and in part used to provide for the daily expenses of his extended family (food, clothes, heath care, and education). He ambitions to have his own house.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 box of cylinders, 30 tires, and 2 boxes of motorcycle spark plugs

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La señora Nelly M., tiene 31 años  D. edad, conviviente y tiene  06 hijos.
Asume el cargo D.  presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Mujeres del Sol”,  conformada por  11 socios. Trabaja con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad  hace 1 año, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segunda, lleva 4 años dedicada en este negocio, también se dedica a la venta D. tejidos  manuales hechos D. lana D. alpaca como ponchos, chales, etc.
Con este préstamo D.  S/.800.00 Nuevos soles lo invertirá para compra D. mercadería D. ropa y a la vez comprar un poco D. lana D. alpaca  para poder incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia, hasta el momento le ha podido dar una carrera  técnica D. mecánica a su hijo y también a podido construir su casa con material noble.
En el futuro le gustaría poner una bodega en su casa y una cabina D. Internet.
Los demas 10 Integrantes, compartiran el saldo restante del prestamo, los cuales seran utilizados en la adquisicion D. productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Nelly M. is 31 years old, is a live-in partner, and has six children. She holds the position of president of the "Mujeres del Sol" Communal Bank, comprised of 11 members. She has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for one year, has been selling second-hand clothing for four years, and also sells handwoven fabrics maD. of alpaca wool like ponchos, shawls, etc. With her portion of this group loan, which is 800 nuevos soles, she will invest in more clothing to sell and at the same time buy a little bit of alpaca wool to be able to increase her profits and help her family. So far she has been able to proviD. her son with a technical education in mechanics and also has been able to build a house with good material. In the future she would like to put a cellar and an internet cubicle in her house. The other members of the group will share the remaining balance of the loan, the majority of them using it for the purchase of products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Jennyfer

texts.en:
Jennyfer is a 29-year-old married mother of three. To earn income, she sells a lunch menu daily from her home. Jennyfer's husband works for a local company.  

Jennyfer has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank "Las Doncellas."  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in baking and selling bread, rolls, and cakes. Now that she has begun to receive larger loans from Manuela Ramos, Jennyfer has been able to expand her business into more profitable enterprises such as her home cafe. Jennyfer plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase food as well as tablecloths and utensils for her cafe.  

Jennyfer's goal is to eventually have a full-scale, nicely-furnished restaurant where she can offer her meals to tourists.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her home cafe business.

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en:
Raheli is a member of the Embacasy 3 Borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 47 years old woman, she is Married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 1,3,6,8,10 years..she also cares for other 5 dependents.

Raheli started her own fruits business 15 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Raheli first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Raheli hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Edubeges

texts.es:
Edubeges tiene 35 años, es una madre muy cariñosa de 4 hijos, vive felizmente casada en su casa propia. Después de sus labores en el hogar acude a las 8 de la mañana a sus chacras de cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas y limones), las cuales se esmera en tenerlas limpias y sobre todo fumigadas para evitar que los mosquitos afecten sus frutos y sean cotizados a un buen precio. En su caso los compradores van hasta su chacra y ella les vende el ciento de fruta a 3 ó 4 soles. Pero en los meses de enero a febrero son muy demandadas en la ciudad de Lima, por lo que aprovecha en venderlas hasta 10 soles el ciento. Por tal motivo acaba de abonar sus plantas para cosechar en la temporada de verano para reunir mayores ganancias que solventen sus necesidades. Pero mientras espera su cosecha trabaja como operaria junto a su esposo en otras chacras, de ese modo sus hijos no pasan carencias económicas.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y ya está predispuesta para pagar todas sus cuotas de acuerdo a su cronograma, pues no quiere hacer quedar mal a sus compañeros que la garantizaron. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cosechas del mes de enero.
texts.en:
Edubeges is 35 years old. She is a very loving mother of 4 children and lives happily married in her own home. After her morning household chores, she goes at 8 a.m. to her small citrus farm, where she grows oranges, mandarins and limes. She keeps her orchard painstakingly clean, and above all fumigated, so that her fruit will not be damaged by insects and can be sold at a good price. Buyers come directly to her orchard, and she sells them a hundred pieces of fruit for 3 or 4 Peruvian soles. However, in the months of January and February, fruit is in great demand in the city of Lima, so she can take advantage of this situation and sell her products at up to 10 soles per hundred. For this reason, she has recently fertilized her trees to prepare for a harvest in the [Southern] summer season, which will bring higher profits and help her cover her family's needs. In addition, while she is waiting for the harvest, she and her husband work as laborers on other farms, so that their children do not suffer from economic hardships. This is Edubeges' first loan with MFP, and she is prepared to make all of her payments on schedule, since she does not want to cause problems for the other members who have guaranteed them. She will invest the funds she is requesting to purchase chemical fertilizers for her harvest in the month of January.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Marpie

texts.en: Our featured micro-entrepreneur is Mrs. Marpie F., 37 years of age, married to Gregorio F., is a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. They are blessed with 3 children but only one is her dependent with age of 4 years. For their living, her husband is a caretaker of a farm with a monthly wage of 5,000 Php and some allowances. But this amount is not sufficient to meet their needs and this is the reason why Mrs. F. decided to engage in different businesses. At present, she has a little sari-sari store inside her house. She is also a member of JTY, a direct selling company for RTW’s and also a retailing activity for dried fish. As a new member of PAGLAUM MPC this month, she is applying an amount of 5,000 Php to add her capital and additional amount to build a proper stall for her store. Her wish in life is to be able to support her son up to college.

loans.use: Additonal capital for business and part to be used for building a stall for her store

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy repair parts for his car

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
Q. Nguyễn Thị (10114150046) is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Q. is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lễ Pháp 1 (4).

Q. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Q. operates a family member's recycling business in which he hauls away junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Q. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Q. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Q. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.452.000 VND from SEDA. She used her previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. 

She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND that she will use to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This will be Q.'s 8th loan from SEDA. Q. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

The other member of Q.'s loan group is Hoàng Thị

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
La señora ANGELA PRESCILIANA B. B., tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ. Presenta estudios hasta 5TOde secundaria, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 1 depende económicamente de ella.
Angela se dedica a la preparación y venta de menús en el restaurante que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro productos alimenticios al por mayor como: arroz, papas, fideos, aceite, menestras, pollo, carne de res, etc. para la preparación de sus menús y con su próximo crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles comprará también al por mayor arroz, azúcar, papas,  aceite,  menestras, para preparar sus menús y así ahorra en la compra de sus víveres.
Ella sueña con alquilar un local para su restaurante en un lugar más céntrico para así poder tener mas clientelas y aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
ANGELA PRESCILIANA B. B., 40, lives in the Las Delicias district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ communal bank. She finished 11th grade, is married, and has 4 children, one of whom still is dependent on her for support. She prepares and sells meals in a restaurant she has set up in her home. With her first, 300 new sol loan, she bought food items like rice, potatoes, pasta, oil, vegetables, chicken, beef, etc. to prepare her meals and with the next, 600 new sol loan, she will again buy rice, sugar, poptatoes, oil, and vegetables for meal preparation at wholesale to save money on her food purchases. She dreams with renting a more centrally located space for her restaurant so that she can serve more customers and increase her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, potatoes, oil, vegetables for her meal preparation at wholesale to save money on her purchases.

loans.name: Laumata

texts.en: Laumata L. is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is single and has one infant child. Laumata owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2009, Laumata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Margret is 49 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 8 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a big hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga D. is forty-six years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvs Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His two sons are ten and thirteen years old and both go to a local secondary school. Battulga is a herder with livestock including horses, cattle, sheep, and goats. He has been herding animals for the last twenty years and is an experienced herder in the town. In the winter, he sends his animals to a better pastoral land. While he is away from his animals, he sells dairy products and meat. He rents a small shop where he sells various dairy products including cheese, curds, and milk cream, and meat such as beef and mutton for locals. He requests a loan to purchase more dairy products and increase shop inventory products to meet the demand from local customers.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and increase shop inventory

loans.name: Birungi Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
K. Scovia is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 40 years old and married with nine children, ages 25 to 4 years.  Her first two children are married while the others are still in school, and she takes care of two orphans. 

Scovia has a business which deals in charcoal sales and her main challenge in business is the unpredictable means of transportation.  Her business has been located in Wakitaka for five years and she is able to make 40,000 UGX as profit per week. Her charcoal is mostly used by her customers for cooking at home, hence she is able to make sales every day. She hopes to start trading in goats as well as build a poultry house as another business. Scovia needs a loan to help buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She is such a hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor spare-sparts.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina C. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Paulina is married and has 5 adult children. Paulina owns & operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Paulina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Paulina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Paulina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font essentiellement le commerce des céréales et quelques articles divers.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  2 tonnes de céréales (mil, maïs etc.)                                                                          
L’approvisionnent  se fait au niveau du village et dans les villages environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune en moyenne un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group are all married. On average, they are 38 years old and have three children. They all live in extended traditional families in Zagnenabougou, subprefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The group members know each other through professional and family ties and make a living by buying and selling cereals and a few other items. The women of Danaya Group apply now for their fourth solidarity loan which they will use to buy 2 tons of cereals (millet, corn, etc.) They get their supply in their village and in the nearby villages. They retail their products on location and in the nearby trade fairs, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs each, which they will partly spend on healthcare, food and school fees, and partly reinvest into their businesses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Erminia es casada y tiene dos hijos (keithe, Luis Gabriel), ella es una mujer trabajadora que alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. ropa, venta D. queso y cereales como por ejemplo cebada, trigo y maiz, ella lleva a la ciudad D. Puno sus productos y distribuye a los mercados D. la ciudad, ella compra D. la ciudad D. Puno queso y ropa para distribuir en los mercados D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar ropa y quesos. El anhelo D. la socia es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos se han profesionales. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Erminia is married and has two children (Keithe and Luis Gabriel). She is a hardworking woman who divides her time between her household activities and selling clothing, cheese, barley, wheat, and corn. Erminia leaves for the city of Puno to acquire her products and then distributes them to the markets of the city. She needs a loan to buy clothing and cheese. Erminia hopes to have her own house and for her children to become professionals. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & clothing

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat S. is 56 years old. She is a villager in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chy Chea, are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare field to grow vegetables to earn a living. In order to support their crops, Mrs. Sat S. decided to ask for a loan to pay for plowing labor and for farming labor. Mrs. Sat S. is the mother of a child who is a farm laborer in the local village. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To pay out for plowing and farming labor

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 61 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Fruto de su esfuerzo constante tiene dos casas, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, por los que aún no los ha terminado de construir. Para Alejandro los retos están hechos para él, es mas, la competencia es un impulso para seguir creciendo y mejorando algunas técnicas nuevas en la agricultura. Es así que lleva 36 años dándole duro y parejo al cultivo de Café. Por lo regular recibe la ayuda de su querida esposa, pero en tiempo de cosecha necesita de operarios, del que tiene 3 a su cargo, para que le ayuden en la recolección de su producto y que luego son vendidos en un centro mayorista de su localidad a un precio competitivo. Pese haber crecido a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, mira hacia delante, por lo que ahora esta planificando ampliar y acondicionar su casa para mayor comodidad de su familia. Se siente satisfecho por lo que ha logrado, y cree que aún le falta nuevas metas que alcanzar. Este su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura cumplir con sus compromisos de pago, además se siente fortalecido con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para hacer mantenimiento adecuado  a su chacra, para así prevenir futuros riesgos en sus plantaciones de Café.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 61, is married and has 2 children. As a result of his constant efforts, he has 2 houses, located in the beautiful Cuzqueña rainforest, which he has not finished building. For Alejandro, the biggest challenges are the competition, which compels him to keep growing, and his desire to improve his techniques in agricultural production. He has been working hard in agriculture for 36 years cultivating coffee. He usually receives the help of his beloved wife, but at harvest times he needs to hire workers, of whom he has 3, to help him harvest his products that are later sold in the central wholesale market in his area at a competitive price. Despite having grown up on the basis of much effort and sacrifice, he is looking ahead, and he now plans to expand and fix up his home for the greater comfort of his family. He feels satisfied because of what he has achieved, and he believes that he still has new goals to reach for. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he assures us that he will comply with the terms of his payments. In addition, he feels supported by his communal bank. With the loan that he requests, he will carry out the appropriate maintenance on his farm, so that he can prevent future risks to his coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his farmlands

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
T. Chu Thị (20213030009) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong in Bắc Ninh Province. She is married and has three school-age children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years, and she earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. T. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by T. from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Chu Thị (20213030009) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en: Sulaina is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  She owns a ladies salon in Kisaasi Kulambiro zone.  She wants to use this loan to buy more cosmetics and hair extensions. She has been in this business for 15 years.  She buys these cosmetics from Kampala city shops and uses public transport to and from shopping. Sulaina goes shopping once a week.  She receives an average of 10 customers a day. Besides this salon business, she also sells second hand clothes.  She rents her business premises at 50,000/= per month.  Her customers are mainly women.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality, transportation and thieves.  She aspires to own a wholesale business. Sulaina joined MCDT because of low interest rates.  She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business and food.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en:
Zohra is the wife of M. A. and has no children. She lives with her husband in a two-roomed house, which is situated in the Pakistani city of Borewala, famous for its shrines.
Her husband sells ice blocks in the local community. People come to him to buy ice in the summer season as people like to drink chilled water. He has 15 years' experience in this business. He keeps his ice blocks on his wooden cart.
Zohra is a very kind and patient woman who enjoys doing domestic sewing. She works for customers in her neighborhood and receives a reasonable income. She has received three loans from Asasah, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner, and has successfully repaid them. Now she is applying for a fourth loan in order to expand her husband's business and live a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase more ice blocks to sell

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger M. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old. Roger is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Roger owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase materials needed to provide service. Roger is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for the maintenance of his motorcycle. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Roger from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en:
Benedictor M. sells salt both in small and large quantities to her customers. She is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. She uses the earnings she makes from her sales to support her husband in maintaining the home.

Benedictor will use the loan to purchase more salt to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a storehouse for her salt since she finds it difficult to store her salt, especially in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more salt to sell

loans.name: María Biviana

texts.es: Doña Biviana tiene 43 años de edad esta casada con Don José y tienen 6 hijos. Doña Biviana desde hace tiempo tiene una tortilleria, al principio tuvo la tortilleria en su casa y ahora alquila un local y esto lo pudo lograr con la ayuda de KIVA, ahora doña Biviana solicita nuevamente la ayuda de KIVA ya que necesita ampliar su negocio, ella necesita comprar gas, maíz para poder seguir adelante con su negocio. Uno de sus sueños es abrir un local más y asi poder expandir su negocio de tortillas.
texts.en:
Biviana is 43 years old, is married to José, and has six children. She has had a tortilla factory for some time. When she started, she ran it out of her home, but now she rents a specific location, which she was able to do with Kiva’s help. Biviana is once again asking for help from Kiva. She needs to buy gas, and dried corn in order to expand her business and be able to continue moving ahead. Someday she would like to open another location and in this way expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A., 60, lives in Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose A., a tricycle driver, and is the mother of five children, all of whom are already working.

Emily operates a variety store while overseeing operations of their computer rental shop. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Emily earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at a piece rate. Emily’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in daily sales.

To help her continue operating her business, Emily is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use the loan to expand her product inventory of groceries, toiletries and beverages. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Emily has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for 3 years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings. Emily dreams of being able to help others from her blessings from the Lord.

loans.use: to expand her product inventory of groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Teresa Del Rocio

texts.es:
Teresa de 40 años, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Cuando su esposo la abandono ella se quedo con sus dos hijos, y tuvo que conseguir dinero para poder mantenerlos, comenzó a comprar víveres y a venderlos, ahora ella tiene su pequeña tienda en la parte de delantera de su casa trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h30pm todos los días, cuando se queda sola en la tienda teme por la delincuencia que se ha incrementado. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo aceites, vegetales y carnes para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere incluir en su tienda una papelería para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old and manages a store in the front part of her house where she sells provisions. She lives along the Perimetral de Guayaquil, a periurban area that is surrounded by a salt marsh.

When her husband abandoned her, Teresa was left alone to care for her two children. She needed money in order to support them, so she began buying and selling provisions. Now she has a small store in the front part of her house where she works every day from 6am to 10:30pm. She is afraid to be in the store by herself since crime in the area has increased.

Teresa wants to use this loan to buy oil, vegetables, and meats to increase her business inventory. In the future, she wants to add a stationery shop to her business so that she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, vegetables, and meats

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia Vive en la ciudad de Santa  Cruz en el Barrio la Morita,  es nacida en la Comunidad de Camiri, considerada la capital petrolera de Santa Cruz, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar su esposo trabaja en una empresa, como técnico en construcción civil, ambos trabajan duro para sacar adelante a su familia y también porque están  pagando su casa por lo que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza para sostener a su familia, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería en cosméticos por catalogo, ella aprovecha los productos que se encuentran en promoción ya que están baratos y después lo vende al precio original, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in Santa Cruz’s La Morita neighborhood. She was born in Camiri, considered to be Santa Cruz’s petroleum capital. She has two school age children. Her husband works as a Civil Construction Technician for a private firm. Both work hard to support their family and also because they are paying for their house and her husband’s salary is insufficient to support the family. The loan will be used to buy catalogue cosmetics. She takes advantage of items that are on sale and thus inexpensive to later resell them at their original price. She is very grateful to the institution for the help provided.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy catalogue beauty products.

loans.name: Mercedes Noemy

texts.es: Mercedes Noemy V. de 42 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos, de los cuales los dos menores se dedican a estudiar y el mayor a trabajar como albañil, lo cual es una gran ayuda para Mercedes, debido a que ella es madre soltera quien siempre ha tenido que trabajar muy duro por ganarse la vida y así darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Mercedes posee su propia panadería en la cual se dedica a elaborar el pan y posteriormente repartirlo por diferentes tiendas y negocio, los cuales son clientes estables. Con el deseo de mejorar su servicio, Mercedes solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de harina, manteca, levadura, moldes para el pan, de manera que su producción sea mayor.
texts.en:
Mercedes Noemy V. is 42 years of age and lives in the department of San Vicente with her three children. Her two younger children are studying and her eldest child works as a carpenter. He is a great help to Mercedes, who has had to work very hard to earn a living as a single mother and meet her children's needs alone. 

Mercedes runs her own bakery where she makes bread and then sells it to different stores and businesses, all of whom are stable clients. As she would like to improve her service, Mercedes is requesting a loan to purchase flour, butter, yeast and baking tins in bulk so as to increase her production.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a bakery.

loans.name: Ejidia

texts.en:
Ejidia is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated her vegetable stall business for the last one year where she sells vegetables and bananas. She faces a challenge of competition from other operating vegetable stalls. Ejidia hopes to open a cereal shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to open a cereals shop, purchase maize, beans and cow peas for resale. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To open a cereal shop, purchase maize, beans and cow peas for resale.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est une femme de 40 ans qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu  le commerce de détail de sacs plastiques, de sucres et de produits génériques. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé et a une expérience de 5 ans dans la gestion de ce commerce. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock pour répondre convenablement à la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui est son premier pour acheter 5 sacs de sucres, 200 plastiques moyen, 3 cartons de produits génériques et divers.
texts.en: Gisèle is a 40-year old woman who makes a living by retailing plastic bags, sugar and  basic needs products. She stocks up in Lomé and has five years of experience in this business. She would like to increase her stock in order to meet the customer demand properly. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bags of sugar, 200 medium-size plastic bags, three boxes of  basic needs products and other miscellaneous items.

loans.use: Purchasing bags of sugar, plastic bags, etc

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Señor José, soltero de 30 años de edad es Fotógrafo de profesión hace más de 15 años.
 Comenta que comenzó trabajando  desde muy joven, primero como empleado por más de 5 años y que después se esforzó para independizarse ya que lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba y deseó probar suerte por cuenta propia. 
Con mucho esfuerzo fue juntando el dinero para la compra de su primera cámara fotográfica y de ese momento ya han trascurrido 10 años.  
 Actualmente presta sus servicios en la ciudad de Itá y ciudades aledañas, es muy conocido por su excelente trabajo, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes. 
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una nueva herramienta de trabajo y poder seguir realizando trabajos según comentó, plasmando y teniendo de recuerdo los momentos más lindos de la vida.
texts.en:
Jose is single, 30 years old, and has been a photographer for over 15 years. He said that he started working when he was very young, first as an employee for over five years. Then, he made the leap to become independent since what he earned wasn’t enough to make ends meet, and he wanted to try his luck doing freelance work.

With a lot of effort, he put together money to purchase his first camera, and ten years have passed since then. He lends his services to the city of Itá and other nearby cities. He is well known for his excellent work, the very reason why he has many clients. 

Jose has decided to trust in the Paraguay Foundation, requesting a loan to purchase a new tool for work, enabling him to continue creating works that capture on film and preserve as mementos the most beautiful moments in life.

loans.use: To purchase a still camera

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora mencionada es D. la comunidad D. Thogo Rancho D. la Provincia D. Tiraque del Departamento D. Cochabamba.
La señora Modesta nació 13 D. febrero D. 1971 en Murtuntani Tiraque actualmente vecina D. dicha comunidad.
La señora es emprendedora que actualmente están en proceso D. organización D. una asociación D. productores D. leche, con el apoyo D. la  Alcaldia D. Tiraque bajo un convenio interinstitucional D. P.D.A.-Tiraque, para vender sus productos D. leche para el desayuno escolar del Municipio. El crédito que están solicitando es prácticamente es para comprar una vaca lechera e insumos para la alimentación del ganado, el objetivo D. la compañera es incrementar su ingreso económico en la familia.

La actividad actual D. la compañera es la agricultura que producen papa, arveja verD. y cereales, la mayor parte se dedican a la producción agrícola en la temporadas D. siembra, labores culturales y la cosecha pero sin dejar a un lado la actividad secundaria que producción D. leche.

Su vivienda son D. techo D. teja con paredes y pisos D. barro, viven con sus familias es casada con  ocho hijos que están en la escuela, son D. origen D. lugar que tienen mucha experiencia en sus actividades que realizan y son responsable con sus obligaciones en la comunidad. Por otro lado su marido le ayudan en la producción D. leche.
texts.en:
This lady is from Thogo Rancho community, in Tiraque province, in Cochabamba department.

Modesta was born on February 13th 1971 in Murtuntani Tiraque.  She currently lives in this community.

Modesta is an enterprising woman who is currently in the process of setting up a milk producers' organization with the help of Tiraque Council under a PDA-Tiraque inter-institutional agreement to sell her milk products to the City's school breakfast scheme.  She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow and supplies for feeding her cattle.  Her goal is to increase her family's income.

Modesta's current business activity is farming.  She grows potatoes, green peas and cereals.  She spends most of her time farming during the sowing season, the harvest season and the period in between these two seasons.  However, she still works in her secondary business activity which is producing milk.

Modesta's home has a slate roof and mud walls and floors.  Modesta is married and has 8 children who are in school.  The people in Modesta's community are all from a place where people have a lot of experience in their activities and are responsible as regards their duties within the community.  Modesta's husband helps her with her milk production business.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a 39-year-old married man with three children who are in school. Through his barber shop business, he is able to educate his children. He started the business one year ago but was previously employed in a plastic manufacturing industry. As a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and has gained business skills. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy shaving machines.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, vive en el sector Santiago de Miraflores en el distrito de Zaña, una zona conocida por sus danzas típicas de influencia afro – peruana, queda ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. Este negocio nació de la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante, ya que de el depende el sustento de su familia. Ella trata de brindar productos de calidad y ofrecer un buen trato a sus clientes. Su negocio goza de buena acogida y ello la pone orgullosa y contenta.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos por ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Asunciona ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ha podido realizar mejoras en su vivienda, por lo que se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad que les aseguren un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 39 years old and lives in the Santiago de Miraflores sector of the district of Zaña, an area known for its traditional Afro-Peruvian dancing. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She is separated from her husband and is raising her four children. 

For more than two years, she has been selling basic household goods and groceries from a small store set up in her house. Asunciona started her business to support her children since she is the sole provider for the family. She tries to stock high-quality products and offer good customer service. Her business enjoys a good reputation among customers and Asunciona is proud and happy to have the recognition.

Asunciona hopes to expand her business by stocking merchandise high in demand by her customers. This will increase her sales income. Asunciona is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her objective. She has already had a loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa's Capital Semilla ('seed capital') loan product. Through that opportunity, she was able to make improvements to her home and she is very grateful to the people who supported her through Kiva. Asunciona's greatest dream is to provide her children with a better quality of life and a good education to guarantee them a successful future.

loans.use: To expand business with the purchase of products in high demand by customers.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco vive en casa de su hermano en alquiler, en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Francisco tiene un micro con el cual trabaja en transporte libre de pasajeros; de esta manera genera sus ingresos para subsistir y mantener a su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar su motor y mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 y paga muy bien.  Por el carácter social, califica para obtener un crédito. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in his brother’s rented house.  He lives in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz.

Francisco has a minibus, which he uses for passenger transportation.  This is how he generates income to survive and support his family.

He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy a motor and keep his work tool in stable condition.

He has been a client of Impro since 2009, and he pays very well.  His character and reputation qualify him to obtain a loan.  This is the second time he has requested a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motor for his vehicle that he uses for passenger transpotation

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth D. is married to a seaman and has three children. She owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector running a small piggery in their backyard. She also maintains a small cassava farm and makes barquillios, a thin-rolled cookie that is popular in the Philippines.

Ruth needs additional pig feeds and vitamins and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase additional pig feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Nephat Ngigi

texts.en:
Nephat has been working in the quarry business for the last 11 years.  He is 39 years old, married to Lydia Wangare, and they have five children.

Nephat was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to  buy another extraction site.

In the future, Nephat hopes to own several extraction sites in the area.

loans.use: To buy an extraction site

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from the village of La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.
