Vestine is also the leader of this group, which is called "Abunzubumwe" in the local language. Vestine employs two persons to help her and she has eleven years of experience. She starts her work at 7:00 a.m and works until 6:00 p.m every day. She is the first person on the left in the picture.

Vestine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. Once their businesses have expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and save money for their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bart

texts.en:
Bart is a 37-year-old divorced man with five children. 

He has been in the retail shop business for six months after diverting from the carpentry business. 

His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, and his goals are educating children and building a permanent house.

Bart needs the loan to buy bread, eggs and detergent for sale.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs and detergent.

loans.name: Sajida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Sajida Perveen is 41 years old, a housewife, and spends her time at home managing her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a used clothing business. He purchases used clothes from the clothes market and sells the items to his customers at a profit.

Sajida is the mother of three daughters and three sons. She knows very well the importance of education, and all of her children are literate. Her eldest daughter has completed her BSC degree and joined the nursing profession, while her elder son works with his father in his business. He has also completed his education through the 10th standard. Her remaining four children are currently in school.

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help further the expansion of her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase used clothes in bulk. Doing so will allow him to offer more variety to his customers, thereby increasing his sales and profits. 

Sajida's husband is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Sajida is hopeful that the loan investment will improve it further.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José solicita un crédito para realizar compostura a una de sus maquinas de impresión y además comprar de materia prima como es tinta y papel, así podrá darles un buen servicio a sus clientes. 
Don José  tiene su negocio desde hace doce años y su esposa le ayuda atendiendo el negocio cuando el sr José esta realizando los trabajos que tiene que entregar. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to have one of his printing machines fixed and to buy raw materials for his activity such as ink and paper in order to offer a good service to his customers.
José has been running his activity for twelve years, and his wife helps him by working in the shop when José is preparing the orders he needs to deliver.
He intends to repay the loan with part of the income he earns from his activity, which is the main source of income he has to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to pay for the fixing of one printing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flowers for resale.

loans.name: Lias

texts.en:
Lias, 51, is a married woman who resides in Reussey Keo, a suburb of Phnom Penh city. She lives there with her two single children and sells mixed products from a general store next to her house.  In her store, she sells many products such as sweet things, groceries, soft drinks, ice, snacks, canned foods and other household products, which yields a profit of $2.00 per day.   She also depends on her daughter’s income, who works in a coffee shop, to cover daily financial necessities.

Lias is asking for a loan amount of US$800 to purchase a motorcycle to give possible transport service for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store and sell more kinds of merchandise.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her family

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es chofer propietario afiliado en uno de los Sindicatos de Choferes de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito es para la compra de motor para su vehiculo, pues el actual está fallando constantemente. Francisco es soltero y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona  de Senkata  de la Ciudad de El Alto. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados anteriormente (son dos, pagados en su totalidad) ya que le ayudaron a incrementar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Es la primera vez que solicita que su crédito sea enviado a kiva.
texts.en:
Francisco is a driver/owner affiliated with one of the city of La Paz’s taxi driver syndicates.  The loan is to buy a motor for his vehicle, which now is constantly faltering.

Francisco is single, and he has one child.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Senkata area of the city of El Alto.

He is very happy with the previous loans given to him (there were two, paid in full).  The loans helped him increase his income and therefore helped his family.  

This is the first time that he wants his loan request sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his vehicle that he uses to transport passengers.

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Aura Luz se dedica a la actividad de docencia en el municipio de Achuapa la cual habita ahí mismo desde hace muchos años, tiene mucha experiencia en este ramo en la enseñanza a los niños.

Es madre de dos hijos los cuales ha formado exitosamente ya que son personas de bien al igual que ella los que ya no tiene a su cargo porque son independientes. 

Actualmente, está solicitando su tercer crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, arena, tejas, cemento, alfajillas y pago de mano de obra con el fin de seguir ampliando su vivienda y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura Luz has lived in Achuapa for many years.  She is a teacher there with many years of teaching local children behind her now.

She is the mother of two grown children both successful because--like her--they are useful members of society.  

Sra. Aura Luz is applying for a loan to improve her house.  She plans to pay for construction materials--bricks, sand, tiles, cement, wood, etc.--and labor to add on to her house.  She wants to make the investment because it will improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials and labor to improve her house.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El Joven Rodrigo es un joven emprendedor, soltero su domicilio se encuentra en la zona Barrientos,  vive en la casa de sus abuelos  hace 10 años,  se dedica al comercio de zapatillas, sandalia de mujer y hombre, tiene su puesto en  el mercado de la zona, realiza su venta  6 veces a la semana menos los días sábados, los días de feria en la localidad de  sacaba son  los días jueves y domingo, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería en zapatos por mayor  para estas fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, esta es la única actividad de joven que le ayuda a mantenerse y mantener a sus abuelos, a pesar de ser tan joven tiene que correr con la responsabilidad e ver a su abuelos, se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is an enterprising young man.  He is single, and his home is in the Barrientos zone.  He has lived in his grandparents’ house for ten years.  He sells women’s and men’s shoes and sandals.  He has a stall at the market that is in the zone.

He makes his sales six times a week, but not on Saturdays.  Thursdays and Sundays are the local fair days.

He will use the loan to buy wholesale footwear for the festivities this Christmas and New Year .

This is the only activity that he has to help support himself and his grandparents.  In spite of being so young, he has to bear the responsibility and see to his grandparents.  

He is very grateful for the opportunity being given to him through this loan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 42 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 24, all of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

Rebecca has been selling palm oil and plantains for the past 20 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from him. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh is 26 years old. She has a little baby. She is a carpenter. She gains from it 4,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her carpentry studio and raising her children up.
 Quyet is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs.

loans.use: to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her carpentry studio and raising her children up.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is 29 years old. She is smart and higher educated person. Nilufar is widowed. Her husband was dead one year ago. Nilufar up brings 2 little children. She is a teacher. She works in a school as a teacher more than 10 years. She is one of the best teachers. Nilufar needs to financial support because her son is ill. He is one year old. Nilufar is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her little son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her little son

loans.name: Jinja Progressive School Boy's Section

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Swaibu. He is the Director of Jinja Progressive Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Jinja with 2500 students. Jinja Progressive Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school requires two systems due to the high population; one will be installed in the dining hall and another in the boy’s dormitory. This loan will be used to install the first system in the dormitory section. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jinja Progressive Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Swaibu ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio P. is a tailor from Guayaquil, Ecuador. After successfully paying back his first loan, his is asking for a second loan in order to keep growing his business at the rate he has been going the past six months. With his first loan, Melecio bought essential goods like thread, fabric, and a glass case to exhibit his work.

Mr. P.’s wife acts as his right-hand and helps sew, conduct sales, and purchase wholesale products for custom orders. He was also able to repair one of his sewing machines, which is now used by his wife, who is a seamstress, to help him make suits for his clients. With his increased income, he was able to pay for his son to take a computer course at the Mifex MERIT Center. In fact, his son is putting his new skills to use by offering services to the community, such as typing documents and other computer-related work on a new computer that was installed in his father's shop. He repaid his loan on time, and is now in need of a new loan in order to keep his business growing the way it has been for the past six months. He plans to increase his inventory and stock up on new fabrics like cotton and wool as well zippers, buttons, and measuring tools to satisfy requests from his clientele.

With over 20 years experience making suits, Melecio has come to understand what it takes to be successful. He believes with this extended access to credit, he can continue to provide a better life for his six children, who also help run the tailor shop when they have free time.

loans.use: He plans to increase his inventory and stock up on new fabrics like cotton and wool as well zippers, buttons, and measuring tools to satisfy custom requests from his clientele.

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan is low income person from Kedabek district of Azerbaijan. He is Married and has four children. He came to Baku in 1990. In 1994 he started his business. He wants to receive a loan of $1200 from Normicro Baku branch.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Mai has 2 children, 42 and 36. Miss Anh, her first daughter, was married and has 2 children, who are twins. Miss Vui, Mrs. Mai’s second daughter, is  mentally retarded. Mrs. Mai lives together with her two daughters in a hut. Mrs. Mai is old, 82, but she still works to sell confections at her hut. The family has a little land for cultivation, about 2000 square meters to plant rice. Mr. Xuat, Miss Anh’s husband, works as a daily laborer, but the work is not stable. Miss Anh has already repaid a loan of $75 for the project and income increased by about $2.31/person/month. However, average income is low at $9/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $100 to expand the sales of confections and rice planting.

loans.use: sell confections at home

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. is 46 years old and sells vegetables for a living--earning approximately $2/day. She lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband, a mototaxi driver, and their 6 children. Two of her children work at a garment factory in Phnom Penh and send back part of their wages to help the family. The other 4 children go to school during the day and help their mother with the crops in their free time.

Mrs. Sok P. would like to take this loan in order to purchase a small piece of land where she can grow more crops. In the future, she hopes to continue with this trend of expanding her landholding so that she can grow more and more to sell to the market. She feels that her farming business will help to send her children to school until they are old enough to find their own jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for growing crops

loans.name: Laxmi Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Laxmi Kumari M., 57, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and five sons. Her husband, Mr. Bal Mukunda M., has no work. He is illiterate and unemployed. Her two younger sons are studying in grades 5 and 6. Mrs. M. and all her five sons make traditional idols to order. They have a lot of orders for making the idols, so they need money to buy raw materials like gold, brass, and wax to make more traditional idols to fulfill the demand. She seeks $300 to buy these raw materials.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making idols

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has a child. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin City.

Joy started her own business selling provisions, phone cards, and foodstuffs seven years ago. She needs the loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs, and phone cards for sale

loans.name: Betha

texts.en:
Bertha is a 38-year old entrepreneur who lives in Siaya, Kenya, with her husband and six children. She has also trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. The cereal selling business that she initiated in 1993 was doing quite well until about a year ago when her husband was laid off and she became the sole income earner in her household. To supplement her income, Bertha set up a fruit and vegetable stand near her home.

Her hard work, determination, and excellent skills have led to her success. Her profits pay the household expenses as well as secondary school fees for two of her children. Bertha plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$800 to buy twenty sacks of grains, particularly maize. As the price of this staple food is currently low, she will buy in bulk now to sell at a larger profit later.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of grains, particularly maize.

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru:
Anorhol F. is 52 years old and has a secondary school education. She is a widow with two children. Anorhol has a small store where she sells food products close to her home in the village of Kizil-Kala. She plans to use her loan to increase the assortment of goods sold. Most of her clients live in the village. The loan will allow local residents to obtain the groceries they need without having to go into the center of the region. This way they can save time and money. Anorhol plans to repay her loan within a 12-month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Факирова Анорхол, возраст 52 года, образование среднее, семейное положение – вдова, имеет 2 детей. Анорхол рядом со своим домом, в кишлаке Кизил-Кала посторила небольшой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Основными её клиентами являются жители этого кишлака. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать необходимые им продукты питания, при этом не выезжая в центр района, что намного съэкономит их время и денежные средства. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Djuraboy

texts.ru:
Djuraboy A. is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a High School education. Djuraboy has been in the business of raising cattle for the past 5 years. This is his main source of income. He plans to use the obtained credit to purchase several additional animals. He plans to sell animals every 40 to 45 days. The obtained money will be used to purchase young animals. He plans to use the profit from the sale to purchase animal feed and to provide for his family. Djuraboy plans to repay the loan over a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдузоиров Джурабой, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Джурабой занимается разведением и продажей крупного – рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько голов крупного – рогатого скота. Через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует продавать откормленный скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать молодняк. Полученную прибыль от продажи он будет направлять на приобретение молодого скота и содержание своей семьи. Это основной вид деятельности, которым он занимается и который приносит ему доход. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Mamoona's Group

texts.en:
I am the group leader, Manoona K.. I am married and a mother of four: three boys and one girl. All of my children are below 16 and attend school, except the youngest who is not yet of school age. My husband is a farmer and now he wants to start a sugarcane-juice corner. He therefore will buy a machine that is used to extract the juice. My loan group members and their businesses are: Shamim B., who will use her share of the loan to buy a dairy cow; Abdul Q., who needs this loan to buy a juicer for her husband's juice corner; and Shaheen K., who wants to buy an embroidery machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy machine to extract juice from sugarcane

loans.name: Balyelesa Development Group

texts.en: Clement, age 49, is the chairperson of the Balyelesa Development Group in Mukono. She is married with 7 children, as well as caring for 6 other relatives. She has 3 businesses; she is a farmer growing maize and beans both for sale and home consumption, she makes yogurt, and she has sold milk for over 10 years. She has been able to succeed, especially with the help of her kids at home. She needs a loan to help with her yogurt business, since she intends to get packages with her own label for more sales. She sells the yogurt mainly to the nearby shops and schools, but with the new label, she intends to sell to supermarkets.

loans.use: Clement needs a loan to help with her yogurt business by buying packages with her own label for more sales.

loans.name: Thị Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Mai (MS: 06030006), 48 years old, is an active woman. She and her husband together they tend a herd of water buffalo, a vegetable garden, sell its product and farm a small patch of rice paddy. They have two school age children. She is applying for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her ducks. Her G. has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lưu Văn Bắc (MS: 06030007), 33 years old, applies for a loan to invest in egg laying hens.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 06030008), 40 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ.
  • Lưu Thị Lan (MS: 06030009), 24 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ.
  • Kiều Thị Hồng (MS: 06030010), 41 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ and egg laying hens.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Mai (MS: 06030006), năm nay 48 tuổi, chị là người rất năng động trong việc phát triển kinh tế gia đình, chị chăn nuôi châu, trồng rau bán hàng ngày và làm ruộng, chồng chị cùng tham gia vào công việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt của chị, chị có hai con hiện đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho đàn vịt đẻ. Chị rất thích tham gia vào chương trình. Anh Lưu Văn Bắc (MS: 06030007), năm nay 33 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để nuôi cám nuôi gà lấy trứng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 06030008), năm nay 40 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hoa quả, rau và bỏng ngô đi chợ bán. Chị Lưu Thị Lan (MS: 06030009), năm nay 24 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán hoa quả, bỏng ngô. Chị Kiều Thị Hồng (MS: 06030010), năm nay 41 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ bán rau quả và chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Alicio

texts.en:
Alicio (29) is a single man who lives with his mother in Carapegua. Alicio is studying farming administration at the university. Next year he will be done with college and he will make his dream come true. He always wanted to have a degree. 

Hamacas (hammocks) are a type of swing very typical in Paraguay. Usually people take a siesta (nap) on the hamacas (swing). Since it is a tradition, there is always a huge demand for hamacas (swings).

From an early age Alicio started working with his mother in the production of swings and bedspreads. They started selling their products to different craft stores, but then they realized that they could sell on their own, and that would be much more profitable. Alicio is responsible for distributing the swings and bedspreads. Thanks to the increase in income, Alicio bought a car to make the distribution faster and more efficient. 

Alicio needs the credit in order to buy more raw materials such as threads, fabrics and others.

loans.use: Purchase threads, fabrics and others

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina is a young woman who is 24 years old and lives in the village of La Ceiba, in the Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan municipality of Sololá Province in Guatemala. With her contributions to the community she has gained respect for her small business in which she has been selling groceries for 10 years. As her father died when she was an infant, she and her mother continued ahead, passing through various trying times but alway managing to overcome them.

Being young and with positive thinking about growing the business she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan of 7,080 quetzales, money that she will use to increase her business capital. She has quite a bit of customer demand since she is the only person that is selling products like hers in the area. This will enable her to increase her earnings and improve her living condition as well as help her two young brothers to finish their studies. She always has as a top priority satisfying her clients with a variety of grocery products.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Señorita que cuenta con 24 años de edad, con oficios domésticos, con domicilio en la Aldea La Ceiba, Jurisdicción municipal de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Departamento de Sololá, Guatemala, con sus participaciones en la comunidad se ha ganado el aprecio con su pequeño negocio en la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace 10 años, la cual desde su infancia quedo huérfana de padre, en donde juntamente con su mama salieron avante en la vida, pasando por varias pruebas lográndolas superar, siendo joven y pensando de forma positiva en seguir creciendo en su negocio acudió a la Asociación ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo de Q7, 080.00, quetzales, dinero que utilizara para incrementar su capital en su tienda, ya que cuenta con bastante demanda, por ser la única persona quien se ha posicionado en la venta de estos productos en el lugar donde se encuentra su negocio. Además así podrá obtener ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida como también ayudarse a ella misma y a sus dos hermanitos a que concluyan sus estudios, y lo más importante es de satisfacer a los clientes con una variedad de productos de consumo diario.

loans.use: Increasing capital for her grocery store

loans.name: Frida's Group

texts.en:
Frida is 28 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 11 and 1. She became a charcoal and vegetable seller in 2006. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Frida now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa started her business because she needed money to help her husband with the costs of raising their 2 small children of 10 and 2 years old. She started her business 14 years ago, when she borrowed money from a friend and contacted a person from the US that brought packages of used clothing which she then started to sell from her home, and later in the open-air markets.

She needs a loan for US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise because the type of clothing she sells is very popular.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa inició el negocio porque necesitaba dinero para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de sus 2 pequeños de 10 y 2 años. Comenzó hace 14 años, cuando pidió prestado dinero a una comadre y ella le dio el dato de una persona que traía pacas de ropa usada de estados unidos. Empezó a vender en su casa y después en los tianguis.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía porque ese tipo de ropa la piden mucho.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq S. is a 43-year-old man who breeds sheep in Bilasuvar region. He is married with 6 children. It is difficult to keep such a large family in good conditions, but Faiq is working very hard to improve his family's living conditions. His older children help him with looking after the sheep.

Faiq has applied for a $1000 USD loan to purchase 15 sheep for $60 USD each, and fodder for the rest for $100 USD.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Sabina B. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 14 and 24. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans. Sabina has been running a grocery since 2007 and her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sabina currently earns about $200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400USD in order to purchase rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, kerosene, etc. for her store. In the future, she plans to expand business. Sabina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Sabina would like to purchase rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, kerosene, etc., to resell at her store.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: G. Mutabar has always been around farming and farmers. Ten years ago, she decided to grow her own crop of potatoes and onions. After several years of doing this, she and her husband established a family. Now they are surrounded by five children and several grandchildren, and want only to provide the best for all them. To make the most of their farming, they have always sold their products wholesale. Today, however, G. and her husband are thinking of starting to raise and sell animals. They hope to go into this business with the profits from their next harvest. To make this possible, they have applied for a loan of $750 for 12 months to invest in the seeds and fertilizer they need to improve the size of their crop and the quality of their produce. Please help this couple improve the lives of their children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel es una persona honesta, y trabajadora ya que lo ha de mostrado no solo dentro del trabajo sino dentro de la sociedad, el esta solicitando el crédito para terminar el proyecto de la división de su casa y la colocación del vitropiso, para asi darle a su vivienda mayor amplitud y comodidad.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is an honest person, and a hard worker who has shown that not only within his work, but within society. He is requesting credit to finish a project partitioning his house and laying down flooring, in order to give his house more space and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete partitioning and laying floor in his house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 52 años, vive con sus dos hijos que son independientes y de familia y con su esposo. Hace 8 años que se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwiches en su casa, inició con este negocio debido a que notó que en la zona en que está ubicada hay gran tránsito de personas, y no fue una mala idea, por lo contrario este humilde negocio le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, no solo porque le gusta conversar con las personas que se acercan a comprar su comida, sino también porque su economía a mejorado a raíz de esta actividad, por lo que se siente feliz en realizarla. Hace casi 5 años que recurrió por primera vez a MFP y está muy contenta por su permanencia en su banco comunal, este ya es su crédito número 11. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco fuera de su casa para tener mayor comodidad para vender.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old, lives with her two grown children who have their respective families and her husband. She has been selling juices and sandwiches for 8 years. She began this business because she noticed that there is a lot of pedestrian traffic in her area, so this wasn’t such a bad idea, and on the contrary this humble business has brought much satisfaction, not only because she likes to talk with the people who buy her food but also because her income has improved because of this business, so she is very happy to have this work. She approached MFP for the first time 5 years ago, and she is very happy to be a member of the communal bank, this is her 11th loan. With the money she will build a kiosk outside of her house in order to have greater convenience to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosc for her business

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Ёкубова Санавбар 1960 года рождения, у нее 4 детей. Старший сын помогает  торговать на  рынке, он заменяет в ее отсутствии. Она торгует конфетами и  печеньями. Ей необходимо было расширить свой бизнес перед новым годом,ее соседка по бизнесу кредитуется в Микроинвесте, она наблюдала за развитием ее бизнеса и решила также получить кредит в Микроинвесте. Сейчас Санавбар погасит последний свой кредит и планирует получит новый займ для расширения торговой точки и  увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Sanavbar Y., 49, has 4 children. Her oldest son helps Sanavbar with her business. Sanavbar sells candies and cookies at a local market. She is completing paying off her previous loan and wants to take a new one to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. sells food supplies like rice, canned products, oil and spices at Coronation near Cape Coast. Leticia has received primary level education.  She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband does printing works. Leticia has been selling food supplies since 1999. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sale to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương  năm nay 33  tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ đầu năm 2005. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn, bò tại nhà. Anh Hùng chồng chị ngoài thời gian phụ giúp vợ chăn nuôi còn đi làm thêm nghề xe ôm để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị đạt 2.000.000/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 1 con bò giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Huong, 33 years old, has joined the TYM Fund since the beginning of 2005. Currently, she raises livestock at home. Besides helping her out, her husband also works as a driver for hire. Her family's monthly income is 2 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 9 millions VND to purchase animal feeds and a cow to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cow

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Composé de deux veuves et de deux mariées monogames, les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou sont âgées en moyenne de 43 ans avec 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes  dans  le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Liées par des relations de voisinage elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de la restauration et la transformation de l’oignon. En plus de ces activités  elles vendent  de temps à autres des draps de lit et des vêtements brodés à base de popeline
 Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire après avoir bien remboursé les quatre prêts précédents.
 Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter : 5 sacs de mil (dont une partie est transformée en beignets pour être  vendue) ,3 sacs de gombo séchés, 8 sacs d’oignon frais (qui seront épluchés, lavés, découpés en petits morceaux, séchés à l’aide d’un séchoir puis emballés dans des sachets en plastiques).
 Une bonne partie de cet oignon est gardée jusqu’en l’hivernage où l’oignon est rare sur les marchés. Elles se ravitaillent au marché de Médine et à Kindjeli auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes à domicile ou en ambulant.
 Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCA  qui sera utilisé pour  rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
 Elles ont pour ambitions  d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation et l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente de draps de lit.
texts.en:
Composed of two widows and two married women from monogamous households, the women of the Djiguitougou group are on average 43 years old and have an average of 5 children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

Linked by the fact that they are neighbors, they sell condiments, cooked food, and processed onions. Moreover, they sometimes sell bedsheets and embroidered clothing made of poplin.

Wishing to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 5th solidarity loan, after having reimbursed the other four loans successfully. This loan will be used to buy 5 sacks of millet (part of which will be made into fried cakes to sell), 3 sacks of dried okra, and 8 sacks of fresh onions (which will be peeled, washed, cut into small pieces, dried in a dryer, then packaged up in plastic.)

A good part of this processed onion will be kept until the off-season, where onions are rare in the markets. They do their buying in the market of Médine and in Kindjeli from farmers and wholesalers. They sell for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and of housewives, out of their homes or door-to-door.

They hope to make a monthly, average profit of 45,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover family expenses. Their ambition is to have a house of their own to live in and to open a shop selling bedsheets.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy millet, dried okra, and fresh onions

loans.name: Oduola

texts.en: Oduola B. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. All her children are in school. She and her husband sell planks. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yiriwaton sont au nombre de quatre femmes toutes mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en  moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et habitent dans le quartier Bananissabakoro  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles mènent diverses activités qui sont entre autres le commerce des tubercules, de poisson, des boissons locales, des fruits, du bois de chauffe, de savons et du charbon de bois.
Afin de pérenniser leurs activités commerciales, elles ont décidé de solliciter la collaboration du programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après huit prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans difficulté, elles sont à leur 9ème prêt.
Elles comptent acheter, 4 sacs de patate, 2 sacs de mangues, 140 kg de poisson, 10 litres d’huile alimentaire, 1sac de sucre, 4 kg de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée (dableni) et 5 cartons de poudre jus de fruits. Elles  s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Ségou, au marché du château. Quant au  poisson il est acheté au bord du fleuve Niger et quelques fois au marché du château. Une partie des patates et du poisson frais sont frits avant leur vente. Quelques fois une partie du poisson est fumée sur commande. Les feuilles d’oseille de Guinée et les poudres de jus de fruits sont transformées en boissons locales pour être vendus. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au bord du goudron traversant le quartier  et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 41.250FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (médicaments et habillements), l’épargne et l’augmentation du fonds de commerce. 
Elles désirent  toutes avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The members of the Yiriwaton group are 4 married women, mostly living in monogamous families, with an average age of 35 and 4 children. They know each other because of being related and living in the same neighborhood of Bananissabakoro in Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

They have various activities, among others selling root crops, fish, local drinks, fruit, firewood, soap, and charcoal. So as to make their businesses secure, they decided to seek the collaboration of the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After 8 solidarity loans, all reimbursed without difficulty, they are on their 9th loan.

They plan to buy 4 sacks of sweet potatoes, 2 sacks of mangoes, 140 kg of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil, 1 sack of sugar, 4 kg of hibiscus flowers (locally known as dableni), and 5 cases of powdered fruit juice. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Segou, the Château market. As for the fish, it is bought along the banks of the River Niger and sometimes at the Château market. Part of the sweet potatoes and fresh fish are fried before being sold. Sometimes part of the fish is smoked to fill an order. The hibiscus flowers and fruit juice powder are made into local drinks to be sold. They sell on a cash basis and for credit, out of their homes, at the side of the road that cuts through the neighborhood, and on foot, to a clientele made up of men and women.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 41,250 F CFA which will be used for the reimbursement of the loan, to cover certain family expenses (medicine, clothing), to add to their savings and increase their working capital. They each desire to have a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen E. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more stock to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell
